quote: I.. I was at... This is crazy! I was at the colony where I grew up ... being chased by a rape gang...
scene: 76   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - MATCHING REVERSE ANGLE ON TASHA

quote: Captain, we need help...
How? What is troubling you?
Don't you see what's following us?!
You look tense, Jean-Luc. Sit and have a cup of tea.
Maman.
I'll make it good and strong, the way you like it.
We will have a nice long talk.
Maman... this can't be! You've been...
Dead? But I'm always with you, you know that.
Strange, but... yes, I've felt that. But why now...suddenly...
Why out here, you mean? At what you see as the end of the universe? Or do you see this as the beginning of it?
We... we believed it the outer rim.
Tres Euclidian.
Do you understand these things, Maman?
Maman, can you tell me where my ship is? What is this place?
Captain, you were reported headed for...
Just a moment, Number One!
Can I help you, sir?
No... no, let's help all of us.
General Quarters, Red Alert!
What is it Captain? Why are we at General Quarters?
I had to get everyone's attention. This was the quickest way.

This is the captain. This is not a drill. It seems that in this place, the physical universe and ... and the world of ideas are intermixed. What we think also becomes real. Therefore, we must, repeat MUST begin controlling our thoughts.
We will report all this to you more fully as our understanding increases. The Enterprise will stay at full alert until this crisis is solved.
What did you do?
It wasn't him. It never was. It was his assistant.
What are you talking about?
Kosinski wasn't the one controlling the warp experiment.
It was me!
The equations he punched in were nonsense, just as we thought.
(almost in tears; to Riker) I honestly thought it was me. I thought somehow... somehow that I was operating on his level.
It's also my fault, Captain. I should have realized it wasn't Kosinski.
How could you? How could anyone... ?
Wesley did.
If you knew something, why didn't you say so?!
He tried -- twice. But I didn't listen.
He's unconscious. Why?
I'm not certain yet...
He phased.
What does that mean?
Parts of him just disappeared, then came back. No one else was paying attention to him the first time.
When we saw it this time, he seemed to be struggling... fighting it...
He's dying.
Save him! He's the only one who can get us back!
Realistically, it does not seem possible.
Captain's log, supplemental. Our position is unknown and our only chance of returning to the known universe is a dying alien...
... who is generally humanoid but with a physiology sufficiently different from our own to create medical problems in caring for him.
Cause?
I don't know. My equipment here does not register his kind of life signs. I would have to guess exhaustion, fatigue.
Is he going to be all right?
What's the boy doing here?
Mom... he's my friend.
You may want him here before we're done sir. He seemed to feel some kind of relationship with the boy.
My name is Wesley, Mister Riker.
He knows... ... We all know.
Will he live?
I'm not sure.
Wake him.
I recommend we let him come around in his own time.
We don't have that luxury. Wake him.
(with a glance toward Wesley) He could die and with him any chance we have.

Doctor... Wes... You and I have other friends aboard this ship, too. If we remain in this place any longer we may lose the ability to tell the difference between thought and reality. Regardless of the risk, we must wake him... now.
Do you recognize me? I'm the captain... I need answers.
Do my best... to provide...
Who are you? Or what?
I am -- a Traveler.
A traveler? What is your destination?
Destination?
Yes, what place are you trying to reach?
Place? No, there is no specific place I wish to go.
Then what is the purpose of this journey?
Curiosity.
That's not an answer. What is it that you want?
I have certain... "abilities." They give me an understanding of -- propulsion. I have been trading this for passage on Starfleet vessels.
Allowing Kosinski to take the credit for what you did.
It seemed the sensible way.
Until now.
Captain, I seek only transportation in order to see and experience your... your reality. I am not a threat to you, your ship or your crew.
He isn't, Captain. I know he isn't.
Our "reality?" And in satisfying yourself, you have put my ship and my crew at great risk.
I have made some mistakes.
Some mistakes? What kind of "mistake" can cause these incredible explosions of velocity?
... I don't know if I can put it in terms you'll understand.

I believe that there may be a warp speed that could have gotten us to Galaxy M-Thirty-Three... but there is no "velocity" of any magnitude which could bring us to wherever this is. Can you tell us if our navigation sensors are right? Is this millions of light years from where we were?
Yes.
What got us here?
Thought.
Thought?!
You do understand don't you that thought is the basis of all reality? The... "energy" of thought, to put it in your terms, is very powerful.
That's not an explanation.
I have the ability to act like a lens which focuses thought.
That's just so much nonsense. You're asking us to believe in magic.
Yes -- this could seem like magic to you.
No, it actually makes some sense to me. Only the power of thought could explain what's been happening. Especially out here.
Thought is the essence of where you are now. You do understand the danger?
Chaos. What we think is what happens.
It pains me I was so careless, Captain. My intent was only to observe, not to cause this. You should not be here until your far, far distant future. Certainly not until you have learned control.
You are from a different time, aren't you?
Well -- no -- not exactly from another "time." Although as you understand the concept... yes, perhaps that term fits as well as any.
And you have this ability to... ah... "travel."
Yes...
And others of your kind can also "travel?"
Yes.
Then, why -- in all of our history -- has there never been a record of you or someone like you having visited us?
What wonderful arrogance. There is no record because we have not visited you before.
Why not?

Ah. Well, up until now ... if you'll forgive this... when compared to many others in the universe, you have been... uninteresting. It's only now that your life form begins to merit serious attention. I'm... sorry...
No, no -- none of that.
He's unconscious again.
Revive him.
Whatever you need from him, you better get it soon.
I suggest, sir, that the first jump out of our galaxy was as he said, a "mistake"...
Or he was distracted by something.
But it weakened him in some way, leading to the incredible jump out here.
Theory!
Can you propose some facts that fit this?
Can you get us back?
Wait, Captain. Not so fast. We have an opportunity for scientific discovery here...
And report our observations how? To whom? Can you get us back?!
I will try.
Number One, you'll take the Traveler to Main Engineering; I'll be on the bridge...
He is very weak.
I know.
The Captain is right. We don't have much time. But first, I request a moment with the captain. Alone!
Strange how he seems to care for you.
He will forget me in time. Which is as it should be. It is Wesley I wanted to speak to you about.
The boy?
It's best you do not repeat this to the others... especially not to the mother. Whatever may happen, it is best it proceeds naturally.
I must get my ship back; do we have time for this?
Yes. He and a few like him are why I travel. (sitting upright; intent now) You have it in your power to encourage him without interfering...
Encourage him in what?
How shall I explain? Are you acquainted with the intricacies of what is called here... music?
Somewhat.

And musical genius such as I saw in one of your ship's libraries. One called Mozart, for example? Who as a small child wrote astonishing symphonies as you call them... whose genius made music a tangible reality to be not only heard, but also seen and felt beyond the ability, the understanding, of others?
Your Wesley is such a person. Not with music but with the equally lovely intricacies of time, energy, propulsion... ... and the instruments of this vessel which allow all that to be played.
You are right, I must hurry now... You are right in something else. He is also just a boy for now. He should be encouraged... but told none of this.
Help him to Engineering. I'll be on the bridge. We must try to get back home.
Yes, sir.
Put it out.
How?
Think! Put the flame out in your thoughts.
Now. Get to your station and concentrate on your assignment.
Captain's log, any time entry is meaningless. We have no choice but to repeat the same warp experiment...
... but wish one variation. A principal part of this warp formula will be the thoughts of everyone aboard the Enterprise. We have no idea exactly how this works...
... we understand only that the Traveler makes use of this somehow. It will be most important that those aboard avoid random thoughts that might change the reality of what we're attempting to do.
Any further advice, Counselor?
When you begin the attempt, there will be stress... And it's only natural that the crew's concentration will shift.
Plus some genuine fear, Captain. You can't notice what's outside without feeling some of that.
ALL DECKS, THIS IS THE CAPTAIN SPEAKING. ALL DECKS...

... I MUST HAVE YOUR FULL ATTENTION. IN A FEW MOMENTS AS WE ATTEMPT TO WARP BACK HOME, IT IS VITAL... ABSOLUTELY VITAL, THAT YOU CENTER YOUR THOUGHTS ON YOUR DUTY... OR UPON THE WELFARE OF THE ONE CALLED 'THE TRAVELER.' THINK OF GIVING HIM SOME...
... OF YOUR STRENGTH. URGENT. THIS IS AN ORDER. YOU MUST TRY TO DO THIS.
YOU WILL ATTEMPT NOW TO CONCENTRATE COMPLETELY ON EITHER YOUR DUTY OF THE MOMENT... OR UPON THE TRAVELER... ON HIS WELL BEING.
THINK OF HIM AS SOMEONE YOU CARE DEEPLY ABOUT.
And now to focus their thoughts on that...
... ALL DECKS, ALL STATIONS, GO TO BATTLE STATIONS.
I will need Kosinski back on the main computer.
You need me?
Yes --
You're looking better.
I'm feeling better.
Helm, set in warp one point five, retroactive course.
Warp one point five, sir. Retroactive two-six-one mark three-one.
Bridge to Engineering...Standby.
There is such an abundance of well-being on this ship. It feels like... ... quite wonderful.
Engineering to bridge, we're ready.
On my order, Mister Data... Mister La Forge...
Engage!
It's not happening... not enough...
Warp one-point-five, sir... ... which is what my instruments have read all along.
Our position reads exactly what it was before this sleigh-ride began, sir.
Sleigh-ride?
Or whatever you want to call it, Data. I don't have a name for it.
The Traveler's gone, sir.
Gone?
He phased completely out of existence... at least out of our existence.
Attention all decks. This is to inform you that the Traveler has left us. With your support, he has returned us to our galaxy. Wherever he has gone, we wish him well.
Have the boy come up on the bridge, Number One.
(speaking toward his companel) Wesley Crusher, report to the Bridge. On the double.
Our next assignment is on this heading?
Yes, sir.
Mister Data, Mister La Forge... Increase to warp five. Same heading.
Warp five, sir.
Same heading, sir.
Come onto the bridge, Wesley. Move!
Commander Riker told me how supportive you were in Engineering. Well done.
At ease -- sit here in Command.
Captain -- that's not allowed. Your orders.
Oh, that's true. I can't waive them again. Only commissioned officers.
It's quite all right, sir, I understand.
Please don't interrupt me, Wesley.
Sorry, sir...
Any commission rank? Even an ensign?
Then he would have authorized access to the bridge.

Well, then, I'll have to make him an Acting Ensign. Captain's log Stardate 41263.4. For outstanding performance in the best of Starfleet tradition -- Wesley Crusher is made acting ensign. With all the duties and privileges of that rank. And Mister Crusher, whether the rank becomes permanent is up to you. At the first opportunity your entrance application will be tendered to Starfleet Academy. Until then you will learn this ship. Every operation -- every function. Commander Riker -- a duty schedule for Mister Crusher. Heavy on study.
Aye, sir.
Meanwhile, you can sit and learn something here.
Sir, shall I send for Doctor Crusher?
Why? Is someone ill? (beat; quietly to Wesley) Or do you want to go tell her about this?
If you don't mind, sir, I'd like to sit here awhile. I'll tell her later.
Captain's log, stardate 41309.5. We are in orbit around Persephone V where I have been sent to confer with Admiral Mark Jameson in regard to an extraordinary situation....
Starfleet received this subspace transmission two days ago, Admiral.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Let's see it, Captain.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: On screen and relay to the admiral, Mister Data.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I am Karnas, governor of Mordan IV. A dissident terrorist group has taken Federation Ambassador Hawkins and his staff hostage. They will not discuss terms with me. This is a crisis I cannot resolve without assistance. The terrorists are demanding a Federation negotiator.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I feel there is only one negotiator with the skills and understanding to resolve this situation. The hostages' lives will depend on Starfleet delivering this man to Mordan. Commander Mark Jameson. Admiral Jameson. The terrorists have given you six Earth days to arrive here -- or the hostages will die. Please...hurry.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Starfleet doesn't understand how or why this situation developed. Mordan IV has finally gained peace after decades of civil war --
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Forty years of civil war, Captain.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Yes, sir. Karnas was largely responsible for the planet's unification and peace. Why should he suddenly be unable to deal with rebellious factions?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Forty-five years ago I negotiated a hostage situation on Mordan. Karnas was a young man then.... ... but so was I. He seems to feel I can handle the situation again. Obviously Starfleet feels that way too, or you wouldn't be here.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: I'm detailed to take you to Mordan IV as soon as you can be ready, Admiral.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: My wife and I will beam aboard at 1500 hours, Captain. Be prepared to depart this starbase and proceed immediately to Mordan IV. Acknowledge.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Received and acknowledged, sir. Picard out.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Nearly 1500 now, sir.
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Well, Number One. Why don't we go and welcome the admiral aboard?
scene: 2    INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD

quote: Admiral Jameson, sir. Have you met him before?
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Your hero, Number One?
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Not only mine. My father served on the Falcon with him. I grew up on stories about Mark Jameson.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: I've heard all the legends about him, too. Not only the Falcon's missions and the Mordan rescue, but the Gettysburg's explorations, his command of the old Pegasus in the Klingon conflicts....
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Welcome aboard, Admiral. My executive officer, Commander William Riker.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: My pleasure, sir. Ma'am.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: My wife, Anne.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Captain, there are certain details of this mission that you should understand before we begin.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Is this the place to be discussing them, sir?
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Why not? You and your first officer are both here.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Yes, sir.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Captain, I am not simply an advisor. On any assignment I accompany, Starfleet has designated me Senior Mission Officer. I control the Away Team and all its actions. Is that understood?
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Of course, Captain, you will command the ship -- but the mission is mine. I trust you are in complete agreement.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Yes, sir. Of course.
scene: 12   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON TRANSPORTER CHIEF,

quote: Response to our message coming in from Mordan, sir.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Put it on the screen, Mister Data.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Mordan IV to Enterprise. This is Karnas. I will speak to the captain.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: I am Captain Picard, in command of the Enterprise.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Is Admiral Jameson on board?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: He is here, beside my first officer. Do you wish to speak to him now?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: So, Jameson. I see time has not been kind.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: It seldom is, Karnas. However, we could save a good deal of it now if you'll outline the terrorists' demands....
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: They insist all discussions will take place here... on Mordan. They refuse to speak to me -- only to you.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: They could relay their terms on your communications channels....
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: They insist on speaking face to face when you arrive. They say they will brook no excuses. If there are any offered, your ambassador and his people will die. Unpleasantly. I believe them -- and so should you, Admiral.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Tell them I accept the conditions of negotiation.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: I will do so immediately. Karnas out.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: For a man in his position, Karnas doesn't seem to know much about the situation.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Wrong, Number One. He told me the terrorists are desperate enough to kill if they're crossed. They're willing to talk one on one, but not to him.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Counselor?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: From his body language as well as his words and tone... I'd judge that what Karnas said was honest, but I sensed a holding back.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Perhaps he knows more about the terrorists than he is willing to admit.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Possible, but I suspect it's closer to the mark if we said he doesn't want to admit failure of his own efforts to negotiate. He is a proud man.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: That could be, sir. Karnas has established himself as a powerful man on Mordan. Suddenly -- in this situation -- his power is useless.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Sickbay to bridge. I am ready for Admiral Jameson now.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: He is on his way, Doctor.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: On my way to what, Captain?
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Just a routine medical checkup. Ship's regulations.
scene: 17   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE TOWARD GEORDI AND DATA

quote: Pardon me, sir, but refusing a simple medical check --

I'm sorry, Doctor, but it isn't necessary. The chief medical officer on Starbase 45 ran a complete battery of tests on me two days ago. Semi-annual exam. You'll find I've been a victim of Iverson's Disease for five years. My "case," as you doctors like to call it, is now chronic. In another year, it will undoubtedly progress to terminal.
I'm sorry --
No need. I do not accept the prognosis, Doctor. But right now, I don't have time to waste, and there's no point in you wasting your time either. There's your information.
Thank you, Admiral. I'll look them over.
What I don't understand, sir, is how Karnas knew you were still... available.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: Still alive, you mean.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: So far as Karnas knew, you might have been dead, sir.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: Quite right, Commander. But I'm not, and I imagine Ambassador Hawkins told him that. I briefed the ambassador about Mordan before he left to take up residence.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: All right. Karnas has a problem he feels you can handle. What can the terrorists want that Karnas can't or won't give them?
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: Mordan has had peace for five years. They have finally come to a state of productivity that satisfies their planetary needs, but no more than that. Perhaps the dissidents feel the Federation can provide more -- technology, science, agricultural assistance....
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: I've negotiated many a treaty on many planets, Picard. I've found that peace -- or the appearance of it -- is often a prelude to war.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: Admiral are you suggesting the terrorists want arms and weapons?
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: They may. I am suggesting Karnas is the last man to give them such weapons.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: Karnas worked and fought for years to achieve peace.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: And he's not likely to throw it away... even for the lives of the hostages.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: I see. You believe Karnas won't negotiate on that point, so the terrorists demanded an outside negotiator.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: I know Karnas. He is a warrior... he lives for challenge. These people have insulted his honor by taking the embassy staff hostage. I'll negotiate -- but I'll have to be very careful in handling Karnas. He'll want revenge for that insult.
scene: 29   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - WIDE SHOT

quote: ... You're late. Couldn't get away from the bridge?
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: Didn't want to. It feels good to be on one again.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: I'm glad, Mark. Do you want me to help you up?
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: You're stronger today...
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: I'm fine. Feel like a kid again.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: This ship is magnificent. Pity we didn't have them twenty, thirty years ago. We could have been together almost all of your career.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: It's so good to be able to be with you now.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: Mark! I'll call Sickbay --
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: No! There's no need. It's happened before --
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: When? You haven't said anything --
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: It'll pass... give me a moment....
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: See... I'm better. It's going away.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: What is it? Do the doctors know?
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: Just body changes... My last checkup, they said I'd have to expect it.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: You're sure? Don't lie to me.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: I'm sure.
scene: 30   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANNE AND JAMESON

quote: ... All the medical information the admiral provided is satisfactory, sir....
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: Excellent, Doctor --
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: Except for one thing.
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: The test results he gave me aren't two days old, they're two months old. The medical file coder always includes the date as part of the file number. He lied to me, sir -- and I don't know why.
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: He is eighty years old, Doctor. For some, the memory begins to fail....
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: He suffers from Iverson's Disease, sir. It affects the body -- not the mind. I just have a gut feeling he's hiding something.
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: I'd expect that observation from Counselor Troi, but -- I respect your opinion, Doctor. And I'll want you on the bridge for the next day or so. The admiral has to remain in the best of health for these negotiations. He might require your services.
scene: 33   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - TWO SHOT - BEVERLY AND

quote: Captain's personal log... I am puzzled and somewhat concerned by the dating error Admiral Jameson made on his medical records.
(rises, turns to Jameson) Admiral, we're approaching the Idini Star Cluster. Would you like to take the Conn as we make transit?
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: Thank you, Captain. I would.
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: Well, Admiral. Quite a little surprise you've pulled on us.
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: Yes. Quite.
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: Neglected to mention... I began some new therapy before I left. Seems to be working. I haven't felt this good since the last time I was in space. The Gettysburg. All I needed to get me out of that chair was the thought of walking the decks in command of a starship again.
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: Admiral... you only have the Conn temporarily.
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: Figure of speech. Of course she's your ship. I'll just keep an eye on her for a while.
scene: 35   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON COMMAND AREA

quote: The admiral displayed a remarkable improvement out there, wouldn't you say?
scene: 41   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, BEVERLY

quote: Captain, no one recovers from Iverson's Disease. There is no known cure, and there are no cases where it has gone into remission. I haven't heard of any new therapy that would have results like this.
scene: 41   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, BEVERLY

quote: Then how do you account for it?
scene: 41   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, BEVERLY

quote: I can't. All I can tell you is that the admiral has been confined to the support chair for four years by the effects of Iverson's. By all the medical facts we know, he should never have walked again.
scene: 41   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, BEVERLY

quote: I'd like you to look into it, Doctor. Thoroughly.
scene: 41   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, BEVERLY

quote: Yes, sir.
scene: 41   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, BEVERLY

quote: The terrorists have given you six Earth days to bring him here -- or the hostages will die. Please...hurry.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: I don't know how much more information you think you can get out of that tape.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Mark... ? My God... what happened?
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: It's a new therapy I've been taking. It's -- working, Anne.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Oh, Mark!
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Mark... ?
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: I told you I just needed to get back into space again.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: You're really looking much better....
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: It's the new treatment.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: No... come here....
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: (makes another grab for her) I hope you're heading for the bedroom.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Stop it, Mark.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Mark, you look like you did twenty years ago.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: You're flattering me.
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Mark, what the hell is going on?
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: I don't know what --
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Mark!
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Sickbay! Medical emergency in the admiral's quarters!
scene: 43   INT. JAMESON QUARTERS - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: I've found traces of chemical substances in his blood and tissue samples, but none of them are in our pharmacopeia. We're still working on alien references to substances like these. All I can say is that he ingested something that's strongly affecting his body.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: Specifics, Doctor.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: Captain, there are so many things going on here, I can't be positive without a lot more tests.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: Give me what you have now.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: His red cell count is running riot. Then there's the cellular structure of his body tissue. It's -- changing. I can't even begin on that until I see what it's changing to. His DNA is all skewed. I don't know how it's possible, but he even looks younger. And Captain... there is absolutely no sign of Iverson's Disease.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: You said there is no cure for Iverson's.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: None we know of. Whatever else these substances are doing to his body, at least they've done that for him. But how or why, I can't say on the information I have now.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: Get me some answers, Doctor. As soon as possible.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: Yes, sir.
scene: 48   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY AND PICARD

quote: Captain....
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: There are some questions I have to ask the admiral, Mrs. Jameson.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Ask away. There's nothing to hide now.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Admiral -- in addition to your rank, you are a particularly valuable commodity just now. Starfleet has a right to some answers.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I'd been planning this for a long time -- ever since I learned I had Iverson's Disease. Since it put me in that chair.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: What did you do, Mark?
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: There's a planet in the Cerberus system -- Cerberus II -- they say the natives have a process that rejuvenates the body... gives you your youth back.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I've heard that story, too. It's a myth.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: It's true, Picard. I'm the living proof. Oh, it's dangerous -- the mortality rate is high -- and it's painful. Very painful. Aliens are seldom allowed to obtain the process, but I managed it. I negotiated a treaty for Cerberus II several years ago, and they felt obligated to honor my request for the process.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Obviously it works rapidly. How does it work?
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: The herb and drug combinations are self-administered... slowly, over a period of two years. Every response is different, depending on a being's DNA. I got enough for both of us, Anne -- but I had to test it on myself first. I couldn't risk you. If I died... well, I was half a man anyway, to what did it matter... ?
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: It would matter to me.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: But I was starting to change, Anne. It was almost undetectable, but the improvement was there. Then this hostage situation came up, and I knew I'd have to be at my peak to deal with it. I didn't have time to wait for the drugs to work naturally --
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: You took the whole dose.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I took both of them. And look at me! Annie, look at me. I'm strong, alert, I'm fit. I'm fitter than you are, Picard. And I'm getting younger!
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: The only question I have, Admiral, is why you felt it necessary to be young to negotiate the hostage release. Surely Karnas requested you because of your age and experience.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I'll be on the bridge, Admiral, if you wish to talk further.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Why didn't you tell me, Mark? We've always been honest with each other -- until now.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Annie, I did it for us.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I'm sure you believed that -- until you had a chance to head up a mission... to command again. Then you just upended the bottle -- or whatever it was -- and damn all. Did you think about me at all?
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I got enough of the dosage for both of us....
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: But you never asked if I wanted it. It's just like you, Mark, to assume that what you felt was right was the only answer.
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: It was the right answer for me. It was killing you, having to take care of an invalid. What good was I to you? Annie -- we can be together again....
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Let me go!
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: I can get another supply of the drug for you --
scene: 49   INT. JAMESONS' QUARTERS - ANGLE AT THE DOOR

quote: Commander Data, I wish to open a communication frequency to Karnas.
scene: 54   INT. CONFERENCE LOUNGE - ANGLE ON JAMESON

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 55   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD AND DATA

quote: A moment, Mister Data. Admiral, this is Picard. May I know the purpose of this communication?
scene: 55   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON PICARD AND DATA

quote: Karnas must have tried to negotiate with the terrorists before he was forced to call on me. I want all the information he has access to.
You said he was a proud man... probably sensitive about his failure to deal with the situation. Is it wise to press him on this?
I'm the negotiator, Picard. Karnas will have to cooperate with me and the terrorists, and damn his sensitivities.
Then I suggest a secured channel, Admiral.
A sensible precaution, Picard. Make it so.
Aye, sir. Frequency open and secured.
Karnas.
What is it you want, Admiral?
We're on a secured channel, Karnas. You can talk freely. Who's behind this thing? You said dissidents.
Yes... political opponents who feel the Federation will disavow me as governor if they stir up enough trouble on Mordan.
Then who is it? Ardan? Gilnor?
They're dead, Jameson. A long time now. For a long time I thought you were dead, too.
I almost died a couple of times on missions, but I always made it through somehow.
Yes. Now you're coming back to Mordan -- to negotiate for hostages again. It's almost as though the forty-five years between never happened....
You've never forgiven me.
Should I have -- after the legacy of war you left us in your last "negotiation?"
There are no dissidents, are there? No terrorists. You have the hostages.
And if I have? You're coming to Mordan, Jameson. You're going to negotiate for their lives, and I'm going to ask a very high price for them.
What if I refuse?

Then the hostages will die. You've seen how my executioners work. They are still as efficient as they were... perhaps even more skilled now. You'll come -- even if you don't have much honor left. Karnas out.
Are we still on schedule to arrive at Mordan in thirty-eight hours?
Yes, sir. We're at warp four now.
Picard, I want a jump to warp eight so we arrive ahead of our announced ETA. It'll throw Karnas off balance, and we can catch him before he's ready.
Ready for exactly what, Admiral?
I believe Karnas is planning something new... something that will directly endanger the hostages' lives.
What happened in your communication to bring you to that conclusion? It seems a big jump....
I'm not at liberty to say, Picard, but negotiation is not the answer or the issue here. The hostages' lives are at stake.
I agree the most important thing is saving the lives of the hostages...
And you agree with that, too, Riker?
I do, sir.
Good. Because I plan to personally lead an away team on an armed rescue mission to get them out of there.
Commander Data, will you bring up the plans I requested on the Viewscreen, please.
Yes, sir.
Most of Mordan's principal city was devastated in the war. What was left consisted of a network of underground tunnels -- a rat's maze. When they rebuilt the city, they simply built over the tunnels.
I have it, sir.
Admiral, even if you're right about Karnas being behind this, he still wants to negotiate. Or at least to talk. Why not hear what he has to say?
I've heard what he has to say, and I have good reason to believe he's lying.
Pardon me, sir, but where do these come into the picture?
This is where Karnas held his hostages before and where I believe he has them now.
Wouldn't that be a little too obvious, Admiral?
Karnas is a dogged strategist, Picard -- not a brilliant one. He sticks to what works.
An overt rescue attempt could push Karnas into killing the hostages outright.
I don't think that's what he wants, Picard.
Then what does he want?
Maybe his threats are just a way to bargain for what he wants....
Karnas means exactly what he says, Lieutenant. He will kill the hostages if we don't get them out of there.
Therefore you see an armed raid as our only option.
You don't agree.
I would point out no one else has heard or considered Karnas's demands but you, Admiral. The Federation might take a different view of them if they knew what they were.
Starfleet gave me command of the away team, Picard. I intend to use them as I see fit.
Is Jameson physically able to lead an away mission, Doctor?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: His cells, his tissue, even his bones are still de-aging, but I'd say he was. Generally, I'd call Admiral Jameson a healthy man... about forty-five... in excellent physical condition.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: What about his mind?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: The same. Brain scan reveals all cells and tissue are changing, but healthy. No loss of memory... exellent grasp of facts.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: Counselor?
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: Certainly his physical capacities have been restored. I sense that gives him great satisfaction. When he came aboard, he seemed hopeful, eager. Now there seems to be a harder, more forceful attitude... ambition....
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: More of a young man's attitude, I'd say. Aggressive... going right for the throat of a situation instead of considering the alternatives.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: Part of that is ambition too. He wants to be the man he once was. He is the man he once was, but sometimes old memories aren't very accurate. He was able to lead away teams like this once. Now he believes he can do it again.
scene: 68   INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - PICARD, TROI, BEVERLY

quote: Our anniversary is next week. Fifty years....
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: In his heart, he's still the same man you married, Anne.
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: That's true. He still cares for you, despite the physical changes he's undergoing.
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: But he's getting younger, and I'm -- well, look at me. Why did he do this... ?
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: There are lives at stake, Mrs. Jameson.
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: What about our lives? Mine and his, together?
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: Anne... I think I know a little of what you're feeling. My husband died on an away mission. We'd been married two years. So little time. Look at what you've had with Mark --
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: Years, yes -- but not together. I was looking forward to time together finally -- our retirement. Now he's young again and has a life to live over.
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: She has to know, Doctor.
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: Know what?
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: Anne... he's --
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: What is it?
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: He's not stabilizing. He may not have that life to live over.
scene: 69   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - BEVERLY, TROI, ANNE

quote: We'll be at Mordan in three hours.
I couldn't sleep either.
I never could before a mission. Always wound up in the Observation Lounge, staring out at the stars. Thinking.
Maybe in this case rethinking?
Perceptive. They always have given you high marks for that at Starfleet, Picard.
Why is this mission so important to you? Why did you risk your life so you could lead it personally?
I want to save lives, Picard.
Noble sentiment -- but too easy an answer. You've been here before. You negotiated a release of hostages with Karnas before. Why is it now your answer is an armed raid?
It's my away team you're going to send in. There's something you're not telling me, and I have a right to know what it is.

Do you know the background? The Mordanites had some sophistication, but were still ruled by tribal family units. Karnas's father was the ruling chief of one of the families, and another tribe had him assassinated. Karnas seized the passengers of a starliner and held them hostage, demanding that Starfleet provide him with weapons that would enable him to defeat his rivals.
That's the official record.
Officially the story is that after two other mediators were murdered, I went in and negotiated with Karnas to bring out the hostages safely.
Are you saying that's not the truth?
It wasn't my golden oratory that saved them, Picard. I gave Karnas the weapons he wanted.
You did what?
I gave exactly the same weapons to his rivals. My interpretation of the Prime Directive. Let them solve their problems with those arms on an equal basis.
That decision plunged them into forty years of civil war.

I didn't know that would happen. I thought, a minor war -- it'll be settled in less than a year. How could I know it would be four decades? I falsified the reports to Starfleet, but I've lived with that on my soul, Picard. Sixty-three people came away safe -- but millions died on Mordan because I delivered those weapons.
Karnas could have worked for peace all those years instead of continuing the war. It's not all on your head, Admiral.
But I started it. I lit the match. Now, finally, I can vindicate myself, if only in a small way. I came to negotiate, but that isn't what Karnas wants.
Revenge. That's why he demanded you when he found out you were still alive.
I'm not going to give it to him, Picard. I'm going to do what I should have done the first time. We're taking the hostages out by force. No deals.
Prepare to energize, Chief.
Belay that.
Admiral, the correct place for you is on the bridge...
I will remind you one more time, Picard, I am the Senior Mission Commander, and I'm leading this team.
Sir?
The Admiral is correct, Number One. He has that right. But I'm the captain of this ship, and I have it, too. You have command of the Enterprise, Commander Riker. Energize.
Yes...perfect. We are in the M-4 tunnel directly under the governor's residence. M-4 is a subsidiary tunnel, but it crosses and links with several main ones.
scene: 76   INT. TUNNEL - DAY - ANGLE ON AWAY TEAM

quote: I am sorry, sir. That does not correspond with the information I have on the tricorder, sir.
scene: 76   INT. TUNNEL - DAY - ANGLE ON AWAY TEAM

quote: Your information is incorrect, Commander. I know these tunnels like the back of my own hand. That way. It takes us to the hatch that will let us into M-1 tunnel. Keep scanning for signs of human life forms. Karnas held his hostages in these tunnels before. He'll do it again.
scene: 76   INT. TUNNEL - DAY - ANGLE ON AWAY TEAM

quote: The admiral is definitely incorrect, Captain. The tunnel schematics we have indicate this is a dead end. It was sealed off two years ago....
scene: 76   INT. TUNNEL - DAY - ANGLE ON AWAY TEAM

quote: I've no doubt you're right, Mister Data. However, forty-five years ago, I'm sure it linked in with the tunnels Admiral Jameson remembers.
scene: 76   INT. TUNNEL - DAY - ANGLE ON AWAY TEAM

quote: Steelplast. Fairly recent installation.
scene: 78   INT. TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM (OPTICAL)
location: TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM

quote: Damn. This is the most direct route. Set phasers to cut through it.
scene: 78   INT. TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM (OPTICAL)
location: TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM

quote: If you have the coordinates for where you think the hostages are, sir, we could just beam in there.
scene: 78   INT. TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM (OPTICAL)
location: TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM

quote: But Karnas might not have them in the same place. There is no substitute for a personal reconnoiter, Lieutenant.
scene: 78   INT. TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM (OPTICAL)
location: TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM

quote: No, sir.
scene: 78   INT. TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM (OPTICAL)
location: TUNNEL #2 - DAY - ANGLE ON THE TEAM

quote: Admiral, there's an infrared light signal ahead. Steady beam, straight across the tunnel, chest high. Another at hip level.
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: An alarm trigger or --
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Reset phasers to stun.
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Look out, sir!
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Their phasers, sir -- set on kill.
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Thank you, Mister Data. I have heard the sound before.
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Is he hit?
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: I cannot tell --
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: Enterprise, this is Picard. Five to beam up -- now!
scene: 81   INT. TUNNEL #3 - ON THE AWAY TEAM

quote: How badly is he hurt?
scene: 85   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: I do not see any sign of a wound, sir.
scene: 85   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: It appears to be another attack, sir.
scene: 85   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: Call Doctor Crusher here immediately.
scene: 85   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: Sir. (goes to transporter console) Transporter Room Three to Sickbay. Doctor Crusher, please report immediately with Medical Support Team.
scene: 85   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: This last attack is the worst one he's suffered, sir. The others were overwith fairly quickly. He hasn't recovered from this one yet, and nothing has been able to relieve his pain.
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: Do you have any answers, Doctor?
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: I'm afraid none of it is very hopeful. The compound he took seems to be rejuvenating the DNA, but it's also sloughing off the old cells too fast for his body to cope. His body is trying to grow and die and regenerate all at the same time.
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: You're saying the overdose of the drug he took is working too well.
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: Exactly, sir.
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: When will it stop?
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: It won't... because it can't. Eventually, he won't be able to stand the strain.
scene: 90   INT. CRUSHER'S OFFICE - PICARD AND BEVERLY

quote: The admiral... ?
Sickbay. "Not good" is a galactic understatement.
Karnas again, sir. On the screen.
Enterprise. There has been an armed intrusion in the tunnels beneath the city. That smells of Jameson. Where is he?
This is Picard. I am sorry to inform you that the admiral is critically ill, Karnas.
(coming out of the chair) That is not my concern. Sick or well, you have ten minutes to beam him down, Captain Picard. Otherwise, the hostages die.
Sickbay to bridge.
Picard.
Doctor Crusher requests your presence in Sickbay immediately, sir.
On my way.
What is it?
You'd better see for yourself.
Picard....
Picard, I have to get to Karnas.
I can't allow him out of my care, sir.
My last option, Picard. The raid failed... all I have left to bargain with is myself....
Bridge to Picard.
Picard here. What is it, Number One?
A new demand from Karnas, sir. If we don't deliver Jameson in five minutes, a hostage will be executed. Fifteen minutes after that, another.
He promises the method of execution will be both slow and painful.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: Let me go. If I turn myself over to him, he'll let the hostages go. It's me he wants.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: It's certain death for you, Admiral.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: My life for how many hostages, Picard? Twenty? Let me go.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: Number One, inform Karnas we'll be beaming down in less than five minutes.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: "We," sir?
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: You have your orders, Number One.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: Aye, sir. Riker out.
scene: 98   INT. SICKBAY - ON PICARD, BEVERLY, JAMESON

quote: Captain, you can't go down there again -- (stops, staring at the boy) Jameson... ?
scene: 99   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: Yes. Exactly why I have to go, Will. As a Starfleet captain, I have negotiating powers. Energize.
scene: 99   INT. TRANSPORTER ROOM - ANGLE ON PLATFORM

quote: Who are you! I want Jameson!
This is Admiral Mark Jameson.
This charade will accomplish nothing, Picard. Beam Jameson down, and the hostages will be freed. Continue this -- and I promise you they will die -- and you with them.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Karnas, if you'll just listen....
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Why have you brought him here? This is no place for children.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Peretor Karnas. You always were a stubborn man. I thought you wanted me. I'm here. Release the hostages. now.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: "Peretor" was my old title. Why do you call me that?
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Because you're acting like the warrior you were -- not like the planetary governor you are.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Picard, I warn you, this trick is going too far. He has been coached... for some devious reason. If this farce is not stopped immediately, you and the hostages will be put to death.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Admiral!
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: I'm waiting for an explanation, Captain.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: He is the admiral. Before we left on this mission, he administered an overdose of an alien de-aging drug to himself. He wanted to face you with strength again... on even terms. This is what the drug has done to him.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: This story you are telling is unbelievable. Jameson is a man of eighty, not -- -- this. I want that old man, Picard. I want to show him this world he helped to make... the scars on old soldiers' bodies... the graveyards of our young dead... the wasted cities we are still rebuilding... and all of it caused by him.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: As I understand the facts, Karnas, you were the one who demanded weapons to avenge your father's death.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: But Jameson didn't give weapons only to us. If he had, we would have triumphed over our enemies in less than a year, and we would have had peace in all these decades. When Jameson gave weapons to both sides, he gave us forty years of war. I want him to pay for that, Picard.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Sir, I think Mrs. Jameson should beam down. Now.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Do it.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Karnas, I've asked Doctor Crusher to bring down the visual records we've made of Admiral Jameson's deterioration. Will you look at them?
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: You're wasting my time, Picard.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Only a few moments.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: You saw Admiral Jameson when he was on board en route to Mordan?
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Yes.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: You recognized him?
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Yes.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: And this is the man you saw.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Yes. This is the man I want.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Never again, Karnas.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Once he took the compound ... there was no way to stop it.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: You'll have to deal with me, Karnas. Whatever you wanted from Jameson isn't possible any more.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: You wanted revenge, Karnas. You blamed your war on Jameson, and there's no doubt he had a lot to do with it. But you had the weapons, and you used them. You could have tried for negotiations for peace on your planet long ago. You chose to fight instead. How many of those forty years of war are on your head?
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Jameson has to pay for his crimes... I have sworn it to my people. When I found out he was alive, I gave them my word I would kill him for what he did. A public execution... public retribution for what he did to us.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Then there's Jameson. He wanted to atone for what he'd done here. Forty-five years ago, he made the wrong decision, and he wanted to come here to somehow right it. He wanted to negotiate, and when that failed, he decided to fight.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Your men foiled that, and all he has left now is to give himself up to you. He's brought this retribution on himself.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: No. I don't believe you. You are shielding Jameson on the ship and telling me this tale to save his life.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Peretor Karnas... there were only two of us in the meeting. You didn't even trust your lieutenants then. You told me old Peretor Sain had ordered your father's assassination. You told me you wanted arms to destroy him. Peace wasn't on your mind. You just wanted revenge. And I gave you the weapons to do it.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Jameson told you all this.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: I am Jameson. Do you want a list of the weapons I gave you? Only you and I would know what it was, because I erased every trace of them from the records.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: Jameson still could have told you this. If you are him, show me the scar.

quote: There. The blood cut you gave me to seal our bargain.
scene: 101  INT. KARNAS'S OFFICE - DAY - PICARD, JAMESON (BOY)

quote: It is you. Somehow... it is you.

quote: Ship's log, First Officer Riker reporting. Stardate 41997.7 We are about to make a brief but necessary contact with the Jarada, a reclusive race known for its idiosyncratic attitude towards protocol... The Federation has been trying unsuccessfully to establish a relationship, and now the task falls to Captain Picard.
... In two days we will reach the area of their planet, known as Torona Four. The Jarada demand a precise greeting. Their language is most unusual...
... The slightest mispronunciation is regarded as an insult.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: The double bars indicate an elongated "s" sound --
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Unless it's followed by three wavy lines; in which case the "zee" becomes a "bee."
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: Exactly.
scene: 3    INT. CAPTAIN'S READY ROOM - MOVING IN ON PICARD

quote: What a language.

quote: It is an insect mind.

quote: Very funny, Dix. What'd you do, lose another bet?
I don't understand --
The bellboy suit. Are you moonlighting at the Fremont?
The uniform. Totally inappropriate. Why didn't I change?
Mister Leech called twice, and there's a lady named Bradley waiting in your office. Nice legs.
Gotta hot date with my fella. I'll see ya in the morning.
Uh, I lost a bet.
Oh well... At least you're ready for Halloween.
Halloween?
I need your help, Mister Hill. Someone is trying to kill me.
Captain's log, supplemental. I am delighted with how the Holodeck has created the fictional world of Dixon Hill...
... the twentieth century detective who has been a hero of mine since childhood.

quote: The illusion is flawless. The computer characters accept me as Dixon Hill, even to the extent that Jessica Bradley, a millionaire's wife from the wrong side of the tracks, wants to hire me.

quote: I need you to find out. Name your fee.

quote: Agreed.

quote: When I looked down on the street, I actually saw automobiles!
An ancient Earth device used primarily for transportation.
Ahh.
Also seen as a source of status and virility; often a prime ingredient in teenage mating rituals --
Teenage mating rituals?
I saw an entire city block from that window.
It sounds wonderful.
I'm going to try it again, only this time I'm going to dress the part. Why not come with me?
I also want to take that historian... the twentieth century expert...
Whalen.
Yes, Whalen. He probably knows more about Dixon Hill than I do.
I will tell him.
Invite him, Mister Data. This is, after all, a leisure activity.
The sense of reality is incredible. When that woman kissed me, it was so --
Exciting?
Real. The subject of this meeting is the Jaradan rendezvous. Proceed with the briefing, Number One.

This is primarily a necessary diplomatic mission. The Jaradan are strategically important to the Federation. Previous attempts failed because they are so easily irritated. A slip in the pronunciation of the greeting caused a twenty-year rift in the relation.
Therefore the captain must recite the entire greeting without any mistakes.
Simple as that.
Yes. If, on the other hand, the captain makes even the slightest error --
-- The captain is well aware of the gravity of the situation, Commander.
I have located a history tape of the last Federation starship to come in contact with the Jarada. It graphically demonstrates what happened when that captain offended them.
The captain is familiar with that, Data.
Should we not run it?
It's not necessary. Meeting adjourned.
Why would the captain not want to review all the information available on the subject?

quote: Request permission to accompany you, sir.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: I have mastered the lingo of the period. Example: It was raining in the city of Angels -- a hard rain -- almost hard enough to wash the slime from the streets. But it never does. When the rain stops, the boulevard dries and the snakes once again slink from their holes. That's when my door opens and the helpless, the desperate, walk through with a heart full of hurt and a pocket full of nothing.
scene: 30   INT. OUTSIDE HOLODECK ENTRANCE - TIGHT ON PICARD'S FACE

quote: It unearthed half-forgotten feelings the same way it dug up sleeping bones in shallow unmarked graves. It was that kind of day.

quote: Status report?
We're being probed, sir.
The Jarada.
Most likely. But it's long range. Can't be certain where it's originating..
One could get the feeling they don't exactly trust us.
Commander, I'm receiving a subspace message from the Jarada.
That's not part of the plan. Pipe it through.
En-ter-prise. The time has come to honor us. We await your greeting.
This is Commander Riker, first officer of the Enterprise --
-- You are not captain?!
No sir, I'm not. I suggest we commence with screen to screen communication so we can see each other --
-- You offend us! We will not show ourselves to a mere subordinate. We await your captain's greeting with growing unrest. End of communication!
Terrific.
Get the captain. You'll find him in the Holodeck.
Hiya Doc. What's shakin'? Are you alright?
I'm just a little dizzy, thank you. I had some trouble coming through. Where's Captain Picard?
He's on ice.
Pardon?
He's being grilled.
What is he Data, a fish?
The captain's being interrogated. They think he's committed a murder.
Shouldn't we be doing something to help him?
Relax Doctor. It's all part of the game. Believe me, he's having the time of his life in there.
I've told you everything I know.

quote: I need more information! Identify what they are using!
scene: 10   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - INTERCUTTING MAIN VIEWER

quote: Obviously we've underestimated their technology, Captain...
(nods, rises; alarmed) Considerably. It appears the Ferengi have us right where they want us -- in their sights.
Are we searching all frequencies? Any sign of any kind of message?
Negative, sir.
Weapon report, Lieutenant Worf.
I have phasers and torpedoes armed, but I show insufficient power to fire them.
Engineering, give me status on power recovery. Engineering, come in. Why aren't they answering? (waits; turns to Geordi) Go below, Lieutenant. Get me a full report from Engineering.
Aye, sir.
It seems impossible they could be draining all power from all systems.
Counselor?
I'm sensing nothing from them Captain. Which could mean they can shield their thoughts and emotions from others.
Which still makes it our move.
Sir, they may know as little about us as we do about them.
Except that they know they've got us in deep trouble.
If so, the question becomes how will they use that knowledge? Is there any hard information on them in any file, Data?
None, sir. Only hearsay and thirdhand reports, most of which conflict.
Which rumors do not conflict?
That the Ferengi are... well, the best description may be "traders."
What kind of "traders"?
A more accurate comparison modern scholars have drawn from Earth history cites the ocean-going "Yankee Traders" of eighteenth and nineteenth century America, sir.
From the history of my forebears? "Yankee Traders?"
Who sail, in this case the galaxy, in search of mercantile and territorial opportunity.
And are those scholars saying the Ferengi may not be too different from us?
Hardly, sir. I believe this analogy refers to the nefarious capitalist manner in which the Ferengi are known to conduct their affairs of commerce. "Never give a sucker an even break."
And what does that mean, Data?
I'm not sure, sir. That entry was only identified as "slang", terms or expressions which typify everyday language of...
I know what slang is, Data. I just haven't heard of that particular saying.
But "Yankee Traders"... I like the sound of that. Has a nice historical ring to it.
Engineering? Join La Forge "down below", Number One. Without our warp capacity, we're just one big floating target.
Aye, sir.
What other pertinent meaning do you draw from this analogy, "Yankee Traders?"
Well, I doubt if they wear red, white and blue, sir. Or look anything like Uncle Sam.
Uncle who?
What have bright, primal colors got to do with it?

Yes, I understand the allusion. Colors that once identified nations during the time when they competed against each other. Red, white and blue for the United States... Whereas the French oddly used the same colors in the order of blue, white, and red...
... and the German nation black, red and gold; the Italians green, white and red; the British...
Enough, Data!
Sir, it was you who...
We're discussing the Ferengi, Data! Mon Dieu, I wish I knew what they will do next...
Given what is occurring to our vessel, Captain, their weapons could be vastly superior to ours.
Yes, Data. That seems a reasonable assumption. Engineering?!
Bottom line, La Forge.
Not good, sir. The Ferengi forcefield that holds this ship compensates... Almost as fast as we increase power.
Almost?
There's a point-three-hundred, seventy-two millisecond delay between use of our power and the neutralizing counter-force of the Ferengi... We push and they push back in equal force, sir.
And what is our acceleration delay between slow-reverse impulse and top warp speed?
Point-three-hundred millisecond. I know what you're thinking. Shift down and then blow hard into warp nine, yes? Come back fighting, whooey!
Can we do it, Geordi?
Ask me after it's done, sir. I want a slow reverse-power drop-off over five minutes... We'll show them what this baby can do, sir.
Give me everything you've got.
Aye, aye, sir.
... and with a sudden, abrupt power surge to high warp speed, Captain, I believe we can break loose from the Ferengi forcefield.
I wish I knew how they are doing this to us.
I wonder what they're thinking over there.
That's easy. They're wondering what we are thinking... and what we might do next.
I say fight, sir. There is nothing shameful in falling before a superior enemy.
And nothing shameful about a strategic retreat, either.
All systems ready, Captain. And communication's restored to Engineering.
Excellent, La Forge. Let's throw them off guard. Lieutenant Yar. Open hailing frequencies.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
At least, I won't begin with weakness.

(looking up; voice AMPLIFIED) Attention Ferengi starship! This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the USS Enterprise. In the name of the United Federation of Planets, I demand you return the T-9 energy converter you removed from Gamma Tauri IV. Send in all language forms.
All language forms, sir.
Sometimes, Riker, the best way to win a fight is not to be there.
Yes, sir. "He will triumph who knows when to fight and when not to fight."
Glad the Academy still teaches the strategy of Sun Tzu... Let's hope that delay proves out, La Forge.
Point-three-hundred milliseconds, sir.
We'll blast full power into warp nine. Ready?
All systems ready, Captain.
Countdown to three. Stand by on phasers. One. Set warp to nine. Two. Divert shield power to main engines... Three!
Merde. Shields up.
Captain? I think you better see this...
What's wrong?
In my opinion, someone is reading every file, every "bit" of information stored in the Enterprise memory banks...
They can do that?
And more, perhaps.
Doctor Crusher to the bridge. Conference evaluation.
If I may recommend something, Captain, with our attention on the Ferengi vessel, we have ignored the planet.
Consult the charts on this planet, Data. See what we have on it in the library.
No response on hailing frequencies?
We had no response. So, while we still have some power left, it is time for difficult decisions. While we cannot have a democracy aboard, I value your considered opinions.
I say put all available power into a full-out combined phaser and photon torpedo salvo. Destroy their ability to sustain this forcefield, sir.
Yes! Hit them hard and hit them fast.
Impractical and provocative. Assuming even that we have the power to support that tactic.
But Captain, firing on us was not an act of war?
The facts are that the Ferengi did fire at us, but we were chasing them. Since then, they've only searched our computers, trying to learn who and what we are.
Your point, Counselor?
Let's talk to them.
That has been tried; no response.
But did we tell them anything they wanted to hear?
Any other observations?
Thank you all for your advice and counsel. Now if you will excuse me, I'd like to be left alone with Commander Riker.
As my first officer, I assume you fully realize our situation. Although the final decision must be mine, this is your opportunity to speak your mind.
I believe we have covered all available alternatives, Captain, but... Are there any other options you wish to analyze?
The only one left needs no conversation, Number One. And it is the only one we must avoid.
Sir?
Total annihilation.
Open hailing frequencies.
Open, Captain.

Attention, Ferengi starship! This is Captain Picard. It is obvious we have a situation here that needs resolving... And we are willing to do whatever is reasonable and necessary. I would like... I would appreciate... your presenting your terms to us.
Captain's log, stardate 41194.8. It is with a heavy heart that I have offered to meet...
... whatever reasonable and necessary terms are demanded by the Ferengi. I fear for my people and my vessel in the event the unknown Ferengi ask the unreasonable. How...
scene: 19   EXT. SPACE - CLOSE ON FERENGI STARSHIP (OPTICAL)

quote: ... can I oppose even unreasonable demands?
It's moving, sir.
We ask to surrender and now they fire on us?
Ready torpedoes, sir? There's enough power for a couple of them.
Ready. But hold at ready, Lieutenant. Open hailing frequencies.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Ferengi vessel, we are awaiting your response.
Suggest first strike, sir. Our shields now only have sixty-three seconds of power available before lowering.
If the Ferengi ship's sensors can read us, sir, they will be waiting until we are most vulnerable...
Captain, I'm afraid I agree. Since they haven't bothered to answer us...
(interrupting; quiet voiced) I'll wait a bit more, Number One.
Fifty seconds...
Patience. Patience...
The quicker we can come to terms, the better, NCC 1701-D.
Who is speaking?
I am Taar. DaiMon of the Ferengi. You wished to discuss surrender, Captain Picard?
What I actually said, DaiMon, is...
UNCONDITIONAL...
(continuing; a difficult beat) ... Surrender, I warn you, is... Totally unacceptable!! We will die to the last one of us before such dishonor!
Hailing frequency off, sir.

Something has seized their ship too. They're in the same predicament as us. Launch a sensor probe. Set it to search for the source of this "something" that's holding us both. Back to hailing fequencies, fast. ... and so I regret DaiMon Taar that I can no longer negotiate unless it is conducted visually.
Your complete message not received, Enterprise. But visual communication is against our custom.
And it is against Starfleet orders to accept a surrender otherwise. Do you withdraw your surrender offer?
You give us no choice, Enterprise. May we have a visual on you too?
Agreed, DaiMon Taar. You should be able to view us now. Do you have us on your screen?
We... are now viewing you.

I do not know how your twisted alien culture has paralyzed our vessel but I concede your 'Enterprise' is superior. We will return your worthless T-9 device and we offer the life of our second officers as required by the Ferengi code.
I am relieved we have no such code involving our second officers.
Is this to your satisfaction, Picard Captain?
Your offer may be inadequate, but I will discuss it with my staff. Stand by for further communications.
(to the Teens on ENTERING) Matthews! Pola! You know this area is off-limits. Boys will be boys, Captain.
Have you launched the probe?
Yes, sir. We'll get readings soon.
If we're not holding the Ferengi and they're not holding us... then who the hell is? Next, you wanted to show us something?
As requested, Captain, library-computer information on this planet.
It has been charted only, from long range scans. It is Class M, but with no indications of life forms, sentient or otherwise. However, you may find this of interest...
Resolving it into our language...
A space federation of some sort. But I've never heard the word "Tkon."

(distracted by stuck finger) Understandable. It has been extinct six hundred thousand of... of our years. (back to viewer; back to finger problem) According to... legend, these planets... were outposts... of that empire...
Data. What are you doing?
Apologies, Captain. I seem to have reached an odd functional impass. I am, ah... Stuck.
Then get unstuck and continue your briefing.
Yes, sir. That is what I am trying to do... But the solution eludes me.
My hero.
Continue, Commander. Now!
Intriguing. (then quickly indicating viewscreen) Again, only legend, but it describes the Empire as impossibly huge and powerful.
Surrounded by stars whose planets formed its defensive system?
Correct, sir. Outposts. And the planet below was possibly one of them...
Excuse the interruption, Captain, but this may be worth it. We're now receiving a signal from the probe.
We'll take it here, please.
Incredible!
That's our mysterious "something," Captain. It is a forcefield of some kind...
Reaching up from the planet surface. What enormous power! How does the legend describe the end of the Tkon Empire?
By their Sun going supernova, sir.
Could this planet have escaped that?
This planet, Gamma Tauri IV, could have been the most distant outpost, sir, in theory. But since it shows no life form readings...
We'll have to look it over, Number One. Stand by with an away team.
And if the Ferengi also realize the forcefield emanates from the planet, sir?
That's a complication. We may have to ask them to join us in this.
Team up with the Ferengi, sir?
We were ordered to learn what we can about them. Do you know of a better way than that?
Captain's log, supplemental. In orbit of the mysterious planet Gamma Tauri IV in the Delphi Ardu star system, whose unexplained forcefield has seized us with a power almost beyond imagination. If...
scene: 29   EXT. SPACE - ENTERPRISE AND FERENGI VESSEL (OPTICAL)

quote: ... there is a solution to this, it almost certainly will involve cooperation from the Ferengi... a life form which seems as unknown and mysterious as the planet we orbit.
scene: 30   INT. ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE INCLUDING

quote: Ship's power drain is critical, Captain. I must now shut down our shields to maintain life support systems.
scene: 30   INT. ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE INCLUDING

quote: Understood, Lieutenant. Open hailing frequencies.
scene: 30   INT. ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE INCLUDING

quote: Hailing frequencies open, sir.
scene: 30   INT. ENTERPRISE MAIN BRIDGE - WIDE ANGLE INCLUDING

quote: Ferengi vessel from Enterprise, this is Captain Picard. Come in.
