Yes. And I heard a voice... a man... he whispered my name... It was almost like I knew him... or more like he knew me. He knew exactly how I liked to be touched... It was the most... physical dream I've ever had. The sensations were so real...
And extremely... arousing.
Frankly, I'm envious.
I did fall asleep reading a particularly erotic chapter in my grandmother's journal. She wrote very detailed descriptions about her experiences with Ronin.
That's bound to cause a dream or two.
So... should we start going over the personnel reports?
You know, I think I even felt a ring on one of the hands... when it touched my shoulder... and my neck. I wonder if I'll have another dream tonight...
I'd read two chapters.
You probably want to be alone. I'll leave.
No... it's okay. Look, I'm sorry we got off to such a bad start yesterday. I've been reading my grandmother's journals... and I know how much you meant to her.
She was a grand lady. You won't see many more like her... You have your grandmother's fire, that's for sure.
Ned... you're welcome to stay on at the house after I'm gone. I'll need someone to take care of it.
That's kind of you, Lass. But I'll never set foot in that house again. And I recommend that you don't either.
Why?
Like I tried to tell your grandmother... that house is haunted.
Haunted?
And don't you smile at me. She smiled at me, too. I know you fly around the galaxy in a starship and all... think you're so much smarter than the rest of us...
Ned, I never said that...

Oh, but you were thinking it. Just an old man with tales of ghosts and goblins... But I was born in Kilmarnock -- the real Kilmarnock on Earth. I've seen things there on the moors at night that canna be explained by a tricorder, or a fancy ship.
I grew up in that house. I loved that house.
Sure... Felisa did too. And now she's dead.
Are you suggesting my grandmother didn't die of natural causes?
Believe what ya want... just don't light that candle.
Why not?
It'll bring the ghost... it's his home.
Right now he's out... wanderin' across the land... angry 'cause he's been driven out... That's why he's bringing the storms.
Ned -- the weather control system is malfunctioning. The Enterprise is trying to fix it...
Oh, sure... and who do you think is causing the malfunction?
I think your imagination is --
Think what ya want, see what ya want. But just do what I say. Don't light the candle. Don't go in that house. Or before you know it... I'll be burying another Howard in this cemetery.
Captain -- I am detecting atmospheric turbulence over the colony... and large pockets of electrical activity.
On screen.
That's one hell of a thunderstorm.
Bridge to Engineering. Mister Data, we're reading an extremely large storm system over the Caldos Colony. It was my understanding that the weather control malfunction was not severe.
It began as a minor power fluctuation, sir -- but the effect has spread throughout the control grid. It has caused unusual concentrations of cumulonimbus activity above the colony.
Captain, I suggest we set up a power transfer between the Enterprise and the weather substations -- try to give them enough power to stabilize the storm.
Make it so. In the meantime, Number One -- contact Governor Maturin. Tell him to expect some... rough weather.
Who's there?
Ned, is that you? Hello... ?
I know somebody's here... now I suggest you --
Alright... that's it. Whoever you are, show yourself right now or I'm going to call the Enterprise and have ten security guards down here in the next thirty seconds.
Beverly...
Beverly... I've come back for you...
Who are you?
Don't you remember? I came to you last night... while you were asleep...
No... that was a dream... I'm calling the Enterprise.
Now do you remember me?
Yes, but... what's happening to me... I feel... strange...
I love you, Beverly... just as I loved Felisa before you.
Are you... Ronin?
That's right... you saw me at the funeral.
Who... are you?
I'm a spirit...
But I don't believe in...
Ghosts? I don't blame you... I didn't either at first. But I was born in sixteen-forty-seven... in Glasgow on Earth.
So you're telling me that you're an eight hundred year-old ghost...

That's right. I found a home with Jessel Howard... she was a pretty lass with a mane of red hair, and eyes like diamonds... and I loved her very much. And when she died, I stayed with her daughter... and her daughter... and on down through the years, generation after generation...
And now you're here... on Caldos... two hundred light years away?
Yes... When your family moved out into the galaxy, I moved with them.
I don't believe you...
I believe you are the most beautiful women I have ever known...
Wait -- what's happening...
We're becoming one, Beverly... we're going to be together...
I don't understand... stop...
Come in.
Hi, Bev. I just wanted to see if you were going to mok'bara class this morning.
No... I think I'm going to skip it today. I'm exhausted.
Did you have another dream last night?
Not exactly...
Is anything wrong?
Not at all. I'm just a little tired.
Beverly... if I didn't know any better, I'd say you're seeing someone.
Deanna...
Oh, now I know you're seeing someone.
I'm not... "seeing" anybody. I met someone, that's all...
Well, you obviously have romantic feelings for him... Beverly, you should realize by now you can't fool me. Who is it?
Alright... the truth is, I met Ronin.
Ronin? Your grandmother's lover?
I know, I know... it sounds crazy. But he's unlike anyone I've ever met before. I've never known anyone who's so... passionate. It's like he brings every part of me alive. He's very...
Sensual?
Yes. Exactly. I can see why Nana fell in love with him...
You must think this is pretty strange...
I will admit, it's unusual... but I'm very happy for you.
But I do want you to consider something. You and Ronin have both experienced a tremendous loss. Very often a shared traumatic experience can create the illusion of closeness... and romance.
I appreciate the concern, but I think I know what I'm doing. Besides, I didn't say I was in love with him. I'm just... intrigued.
You know, Captain... I moved to this colony because it was a recreation of Scotland. But I must admit, it's becoming a little too realistic.
What the hell is going on?
It appears to be a concentrated suspension of water vapor, approximately one degree Celsius.
Fog?
It just sort of... rolled in on us, sir.
There has been a malfunction in the ship's environmental controls.
We've traced the problem to the power transfer beam -- we're getting some sort of feedback from one of the colony's weather substations.
Another power fluctuation?
Captain -- the temperature in Ten Forward has dropped below freezing... and Deck Nineteen has just lost gravity.
Mister Data -- disengage the power transfer.
I am unable to terminate the connection, sir. A feedback loop has formed in the transfer beam. I will have to go to the substation and attempt to correct the problem from there.
Make it so.
In the meantime, I think I'll get my jacket.
It appears that the station is experiencing a system-wide power failure.
How's that possible? The back-up systems should have --
Data -- I think I just found the problem...
You are dismantling the primary power conduit. I must ask you to stop.
No...
Get away from me!
He'll kill us all! You don't understand --
He is dead.

From what I can tell, he was trying to shut down the entire weather control system... He was pulling out the primary plasma conduit... that's probably what caused the plasma discharge that killed him.
I knew Ned Quint. He was an honest man... he mostly kept to himself. I can't imagine why he would do something like this...
It'll take some time to get the system back on-line... I'd say we need another day, at least.
In the meantime, Governor, you should expect the weather problems to continue.
Commander Data -- you'd better take a look at this.
Data, you said you saw a plasma discharge coming from the console when Quint was killed...
That is correct.
Well, that's not what killed him. I'm detecting an anomalous energy residual throughout his body... all the way down to the cellular level.
Whatever it is, it's definitely not the result of a plasma discharge.
Anything?
I cannot identify the energy residual. However, it appears to have the same anaphasic signature as the power fluctuations we observed in the weather control system.
Then it's possible that whatever caused the weather malfunctions also killed Quint...
It is possible.
We should scan the colony for any energy readings that match this anaphasic signature.
Governor, with your permission, I'd like to take the body back to the ship to run a few more tests.
Of course, Doctor.
Ensign, have Doctor Selar run a bio-spectral analysis.
You're not going to run the tests yourself?
No. There are some things I have to attend to...
Ronin... I have to talk to you... are you here?
I'm here, Beverly... did you miss me?
Yes.... But... I must talk to you. There's been an accident...
I know. Quint is dead.
Do you know what happened? What was he trying to do?
Beverly... there's something more important we have to talk about...
Ronin... I've got to know. Quint's dead...
Ronin?
Yes...
I need you to help me...
Help you?
It's not easy for me to take corporeal form... I can't do it for long. I want you to light the candle...
Quint said it was your home... is that true?
Yes... if I'm away from it for too long, I begin to weaken. That's why the women in your family have always kept the candle lit.
The candle is on my ship... I'll go get it...
No... there's no time... I'll go with you...
How... ?
The power transfer beam... I can travel along it.
After I light the candle, then what?
Then we'll be together... always.
Computer, secure door.
I lit the candle... where are you?
It's all right... we're together... we're going to be one... I'll become part of you, Beverly. Would you like that?
Yes... more than anything.
As it was with your grandmother... and your great-grandmother... and all of the Howard women before them... I'll take care of you. And you'll feel love as you've never felt it before...
Beverly... what the hell is this?
I thought it was pretty self-explanatory. I'm leaving Starfleet. Energize.
Belay that order. Beverly, you can't just... resign.
I can -- and I have. I've decided to stay on Caldos and become a healer, like my grandmother. It's a proud Howard tradition, and I've decided to uphold it. Energize.
I've resigned my commission. Now unless you plan on kidnapping me...

Beverly was attracted to Ronin in a very... intense and intimate way. I warned her that they had both experienced a recent loss... but she seemed very defensive about it... so I left her alone. I could sense she was holding something back... she wasn't telling me the whole truth...
Do you think this Ronin may be exerting some sort of influence on her... that she may be staying because of him?
It's possible. She may really believe she's in love...
It's a rash decision... ill-considered... not like Beverly at all.
I agree. But she does have the right to make that choice, even if we feel it's a bad one.
Come.
Captain, Geordi and I have detected an energy residual with the same anaphasic signature as the one we found in Ned Quint's body.
Where?
Approximately seventeen kilometers from the center of the colony. It is coming from the cemetery, sir.
I want you to go down to the cemetery... see if you can pinpoint the source.
Aye sir.
In the meantime, I would very much like to meet this... Ronin.
The energy readings are coming from this area, but I can't get an exact location. I'll try to narrow the scan field...
The energy readings appear to be originating approximately eight meters below the surface.
I believe they are concentrated within this burial site.
I'm so glad you're here... right now I can't imagine what life was like before I met you.
And it will only get better.
Ronin... I had no idea I could feel this way...
We're nearly merged now... as two candles join to form a single light... so we will flourish as one...
I love you, Beverly.
I love you...
Beverly...
Jean-Luc...
I'm sorry for startling you. I knocked, but there was no answer.
What do you want?
I hoped to meet your new friend... Ronin.
He's... not here.
Oh. Well, if you don't mind I'll wait. I'm anxious to meet this remarkable young man who swept away not only one, but two of the Howard women.
Jealousy doesn't become you, Jean-Luc.
Beverly... did you change the color of your eyes?
Yes... I just got tired of the old color. Don't you think this suits me?
I think I liked your eyes the way they were before...
I think I liked you the way you were before, Beverly.
Well, this is the way I am now. This is my life. I've made my decision and I'm not going to change my mind, so please leave me alone.
No... there's something's wrong here. This is about more than just an obsessive love affair that's gotten out of hand... Why is it that no one has seen this Ronin except you?
Alright, Captain. Here I am.
And I believe Beverly asked you to leave.
So, you're Ronin... it's a pleasure to meet you. Where are you from?
Earth. Scotland.
How long have you been here on Caldos?
All that matters is that I'm here now. And that Beverly and I plan to be together for the rest our lives.
That's a very... romantic notion. Especially for two people who have just met. Don't you think perhaps you're rushing into things a bit?
I think you're a jealous man who can't bear the thought of losing a beautiful woman like Beverly.
Data to Picard.
Go ahead.
Captain, we have located the source of the energy residual. It appears to be concentrated within Felisa Howard's coffin.
Captain, we'd like permission to exhume the body.
You can't do that. Leave her alone...
Why? What are you afraid of?
I'm not afraid of anything. But I won't let you desecrate her grave.
Mister Data, contact Governor Maturin and ask for permission to exhume the body. Picard out.
I won't stand for this... I'll go to the governor myself.
Go ahead. But I'll be surprised if the governor knows who you are. He'll probably have the same questions I do. How did you come to Caldos? What ship did you arrive on?
Jean-Luc, leave him alone --
Answer the question, Ronin. What ship? I'd like to look at the passenger list. Where have you been living here on Caldos? What's your position here? Who are your neighbors?
Come on, Beverly -- we have to get out of here.
Jean-Luc...
Beverly, we must stop the others. They cannot exhume the body.
We can't leave him... he'll die.
You must come. I am your love. I'm the one who will take care of you.
No... no, I can't just let him die...
Beverly... come with me.
No... no!
I'm going to stop them.
I'm alright... Beverly... you must go after him... go to the cemetery...
La Forge to Enterprise -- we're ready down here.
I am reading definite signs of anaphasic energy in her body -- it appears to extend to the cellular level.
How's that possible? She wasn't anywhere near the weather station when Quint was killed... she died of natural causes...
I suggest we run a deep tissue scan to look for --
Stop -- NO!
Ronin -- stop this... please...
Beverly, it's all right... have trust in me..
You're not Nana... Nana's dead. Leave her alone.
Beverly, these men were trying to stop us from being together. Once they're gone, everything will be all right.
No... I won't let you hurt my friends.
No, it won't. I scanned myself with the tricorder. You've been infusing me with the same anaphasic energy that killed Quint...
He was trying to destroy me... I had to defend myself... But I would never hurt you, Beverly. I'm here to protect you...

No, you're not. There's no such thing as a ghost... you're some sort of... anaphasic lifeform... Anaphasic energy is extremely unstable... without an organic host to maintain your molecular cohesion, you'd die... isn't that right?
Beverly...
I scanned the candle, too... the flame is plasma-based... you were using it as a temporary receptacle for yourself... until you could get to me... so you could "merge" with me...
You've been using me... Nana... my whole family... for centuries...
And I loved all of them... and they loved me. Give me the candle, Beverly.
No...
Put it down -- or I'll kill him.
Very good... now set it down... then walk way.
NO!
Crusher to Riker. Wil -- I want you to shut down all plasma conduits in the weather control system. I'll explain later.
Understood.
You've got nowhere left to go...
Yes, I do...
Keep away from me...

Somehow he realized that one of my ancestors had a biochemistry that was compatible with his energy matrix... I imagine he took human form and seduced her the same way he did me. He had some sort of hypnotic... almost telepathic control.
It's strange... I was about to be initiated into a very unusual relationship... I guess you could call it a family tradition. And there's a part of me that's a little sad...
How so?
I re-read the entries in my grandmother's journals. Whatever else he might have done... he made her very happy.
Aft shields buckling!
Transfer auxiliary power to shields!
Aft shields are gone!
We cannot win. We must withdraw.
Keep your place!
New course... three zero seven... mark two seven five.
But sir---!
GhoS!
We are entering the star's corona... we will reach the photosphere in thirty seconds.
Stand-by to enter warp on my command, course two five zero mark zero one five.
Shields failing... outer hull temperature exceeding design limits...
Captain!
Maintain course...
They're closing on us!
Stand-by...
DaH!
Captain's log, stardate 45020.4. We have arrived at Starbase Two-thirty-four, where I have taken the opportunity to make a proposal to Fleet Admiral Shanthi.
There have been three major engagements in the last two weeks... all of them won by ships loyal to the Duras family.
None of which is our concern, Jean-Luc. The Klingon civil war is, by definition, an internal matter of the Empire.
Agreed. But if the Duras are being aided by the Romulans, then it becomes very much our concern.

The Romulans have been trying to destroy the Federation/Klingon Alliance for over twenty years, and at the same time, the Duras have been secretly conspiring with the Romulans. Doesn't it strike you as odd that the Duras are able to field such an overpowering force against Gowron? That they outmatch him at almost every turn?
Some would call it good leadership.

And some would say they must be getting help. The Romulans have always been willing to take enormous risks in order to gain any advantage over the Federation. Can we seriously believe that now, with the future of the entire Klingon Empire hanging in the balance, they are content to simply stand by and watch?
What is it you propose, Captain?

We must stop the flow of supplies and equipment from the Romulans to the Duras family. I propose we take a fleet of ships to the Romulan/Klingon border. We'll take no offensive action, but we'll be in a position to expose any Romulan shipments that try to cross the border.
A blockade... But how will you overcome the Romulan cloaking device?

My chief engineer has developed a system that should help us nullify that advantage. Each ship will send out an active tachyon beam to the other ships in the blockade fleet. In theory, any cloaked vessel that tries to pass between our ships should cross one of those beams and be detected.
I'll have to clear this with the Federation Council... In the meantime, assemble your fleet, Captain.
Nicely done... I hope you know what you're doing.
So do I, Number One.
Captain's log, stardate 45021.3. Convincing Starfleet Command to establish a blockade was relatively painless. Implementing that plan is proving more troublesome.
Starfleet is stretched pretty thin across the quadrant. There are only twelve ships within one day's travel of this position.
The only other ships available are either in spacedock for repairs or still under construction. Most of them don't even have full crews yet.
But we could probably pick up seven... maybe eight more ships.
Mister La Forge, will we be able to implement your tachyon detection grid with twenty ships?
It's possible... But the more ships, the bigger the net we can throw.

I want to add the Tian Nan Men, the Hermes, and the Sutherland to join us whether the yard superintendent thinks they're ready or not. Mister Data, select a group of experienced officers from the Enterprise to augment the crews of those ships.
Yes, sir.
Will, I want you to command the Excalibur. Her crew was reassigned when she put in for repairs. Geordi, you'll serve as his first officer.
(continuing, to everyone) I want the fleet to be underway by oh nine hundred tomorrow. Thank you, gentlemen.
Yes, Data?
May I ask a question of a... personal nature, sir?
Yes.
Why have I not been assigned to command a ship in the fleet?
Well... I felt that you were needed here. Why do you ask?

You have commented on the lack of senior officers available for this mission. I believe that my twenty-six years of Starfleet service qualify me for such a post. However, if you do not believe the time has arrived for an android to command a starship, then perhaps I should address myself to improving---
Commander... I believe the starship Sutherland will need a captain. I can think of no one more suited to the task than you.
Thank you, Captain.
You always did have fools working for you, Larg... now you don't have as many!
You were lucky, Kurn... but luck always runs out. Someday I will stand over your broken corpse and drink to the victory of the Duras!
(stands and claps Worf on shoulder) Ah, Worf... good. This piece of baktag is Captain Larg. He commanded the squadron that tried to destroy us yesterday.
The infamous Worf, son of Mogh. (pretends to looks Worf over) What are you wearing? That's the uniform of a Klingon.
The Capital City is neutral ground... and Larg's men are all around us. (beat, then pointed to Larg) As are mine.
Good to drink with you, Kurn. (pounds the pitcher of drink on the table) May you die well.
Die well, Larg.
You drink with our enemy...
How many are Gowron's men... how many are Duras? Does it matter? When we meet in battle we'll fight to the death, but here... we're all warriors... all Klingons.
The repairs on the Hegh'ta are proceeding. The port stabilizers are---
Is there nothing in your heart but duty?
It is my responsibility to oversee the repairs aboard ship.

We all have responsibilities and duties... But we are warriors fighting in a great war! Think of it... you and I will fight battles others can only dream of... our time for glory is here. This is not the time to worry about stabilizers. (stands and shouts to the crowd) It is a time to celebrate... for tomorrow we may die!
Come... let the sons of Mogh live this night as if it were our last!
Worf is not like his brother.
No. He tries to be... but he is still unsure of himself.
Perhaps he needs something to help restore his... confidence.
I think he'll find our offer appealing.
I'll make sure he does.
You've got to keep that mixture above ninety percent or we'll never leave orbit.
I am Lieutenant Commander Data.
Lieutenant Commander Christopher Hobson.
By order of Starfleet, I hereby take command of this vessel. Please note the time and date in the ship's log.
Yes, sir.
Computer, what is the status of the dilithium matrix?
The audio pick up circuits aren't functioning. You can still access the computer manually.
Excuse me... sir? I'd like to request a transfer.
May I ask why?
I don't believe I would be... a good first officer for you.
Your service record to date suggests that you would perform that function competently.
That's not what I mean. I don't think that I would be a good first officer for you.
Why?
Frankly, sir... I don't believe in your ability to command this ship.

You're a fellow officer and I respect that... but no one would suggest that a Klingon would make a good ship's counselor or that a Berellian could be an engineer. They're just not suited for those positions. By the same token, I don't think that an android is a good choice to be captain.
I understand your concerns. Request denied.
The Endeavor has cleared the dock, Captain. All ships standing by.
Good. Course one one eight mark three five seven, full impulse power Signal the fleet to get underway. We'll enter warp once we're clear of the system.
Aye, sir.
Engage.
The Romulan convoy is late. We need those supplies.
Gowron has suffered another loss near the Mempa system. His forces will not threaten you in that region for some time.
But if Gowron tries to---
(without raising her voice) The convoy will arrive in due course.
A Federation fleet has just left Starbase Two-thirty-four... they've set course for Klingon territory.
How many?
At least twenty starships.
Who's commanding this fleet?
Picard.
What does it mean? Is the Federation going to enter the war? Should we attack them before they get here?
Silence the child, or send him away.
Movar, I want you to return to Romulus immediately. (picks up PADD and taps in something) Have all available ships rendezvous at these coordinates in two days.
Yes, Commander.
Twenty ships aren't enough to wage a war... Starfleet must be bluffing.
Perhaps...
Our forces in the Mempa sector are now in full retreat. They will have to regroup near Beta Lankal.
We destroyed their supply bases in that sector three weeks ago! How can they continue to fight?
They must be getting help.
Maybe they have better leaders.
I say you have failed as our leader, Gowron.
There is no time for this! We must make plans before those forces reach Beta Lankal!
How can we oppose the Duras when we continue to fight among ourselves?
Gowron must answer a challenge to his authority.
Stop this! Are we to fall upon each other like a pack of Ferengi? The enemy is the Duras! We are at war!
Now the war can continue.
We're crossing into Klingon territory, Captain.
Signal the fleet to maintain yellow alert until further notice.
Aye, sir.
Begin long-range scans of the Romulan border.
No uncloaked ships within sensor range... a few subspace anomalies, but nothing firm.
Those anomalies could be cloaked ships.
Could be, sir.
Open a channel to the Excalibur.
Excalibur, Riker here.
Deploy the fleet, Will. It's time to spread our net.
Yes, sir.
We've arrived at the designated coordinates, Captain.
All stop. Notify the flagship that we have assumed station.
Starboard power coupling has overloaded. We've got a radiation leak on decks ten through twelve.
Why are auxiliary back-ups not functioning?
There wasn't enough time to test all the back-ups before leaving the yard. (beat, then to N.D. Crewman) Terry, I want you down in engineering working on a new coupling.
You have taken the phaser and torpedo control units off-line.
Keith, you and I'll start bringing the coolant levels down in---
Mister Hobson, it is inappropriate for you to determine a course of action without consulting the commanding officer.
I was trying to safeguard the lives of people on those decks, but you're right. Belay those orders, everyone. The phasers and torpedos are back on-line. What should we do, sir?
Take the phasers and torpedo units off-line and begin repairs on the starboard power coupling.
Thank you, sir. You heard the Captain, everyone.
We're ready, sir.
Mister La Forge, how long do you think it will take the Romulans to detect the tachyon field once it's activated?
Not long... Romulan sensors are as good as ours.
Very well. Energize the network.
Captain, the tachyon network is active.
Acknowledged.
Captain, the net has picked up five cloaked ships... they're stationary... about five thousand kilometers directly ahead.
They've probably been sitting there watching us for some time now.
There is an increase in tachyon emissions from the Federation ships.
They're using the beams as a detection field...
If we try to cross it, they'll see us... even if we're cloaked.
Issue orders to begin work on a way to penetrate this field. In the meantime, we'll have to convince Captain Picard he should leave.
New readings... Romulan ship decloaking!
Shall I raise shields?
Not yet.
They're hailing us, sir.
On screen.
Tasha?
No, Captain. I am Commander Sela. The woman you knew as Tasha Yar... was my mother.
Deploying an invasion fleet along our border is a clear act of aggression, Captain. It will not be tolerated. You have twenty hours to recall your ships and return peacefully to Federation territory.
Then you believe her, Counselor?
I'm not saying we should accept her claim at face value... but I sensed no deception from her. She really believes that she is the daughter of Tasha Yar.
Regardless of what she believes, Sela cannot be her daughter. I've reviewed all of Tasha's medical records, and there is no indication that she was ever pregnant.
Besides, Tasha would have been a child when this woman was born.
Sela could have been cloned.
Or had her appearance surgically altered...
But why? What possible advantage do the Romulans think they would gain?
As it now stands, I don't see how this has any impact on our present strategy. We'll continue the blockade and leave the next move to them.
Am I intruding?
Not at all. Is something wrong?
Word travels fast. I heard that Tasha Yar's daughter is on the Romulan ship.
I think the Romulans have created what they hope will be a distraction... something to keep us off balance.
Is that what you really think? Or is there some part of you... that wonders?
Because part of me does...
How much do you know about what happened to the last ship named Enterprise?
The Enterprise C? It was lost... at the battle of Narendra Three... while defending a Klingon outpost from the Romulans.
And... the survivors?
There were stories... that there might have been prisoners, taken back to Romulus. But those were just rumors.
There were survivors. And one of them was Tasha Yar.
Guinan... that was twenty-three years ago... Tasha was still a child...
I know. But I also know she was on that ship -- and she wasn't a child. And Picard... you sent her there.
How could you know these things?
I don't know how I know. I just do. I remember it.
I can see her.. in my mind... asking me a question... And then it's gone...
Tasha died... a year before you came to the Enterprise. You never met her.
I know that... but I also know I'm right.
If you have nothing more than a vague intuition...
That's all I have. But I listen to it... and you should do the same.
You can't just dismiss this. If I'm right... if you did send Tasha Yar on that ship... then, in a way, Picard... you're responsible for her daughter.
I think... it's time I met Commander Sela.
We are at war! Gowron should forbid any challenges until we are victorious.
A Klingon does not... postpone a matter of honor.
A Klingon should place the good of the Empire above his own pride!
So now Gowron no longer suits you... perhaps you mean to challenge him for the leadership of the Council?
No.
Then do not speak of this again! I did not wish to follow Gowron... you came to me and insisted we support him against the Duras family. The time for debate is over!
We are Klingons. He is our leader. If that is not enough for you, then perhaps you made the wrong choice when you put on that uniform.
Well, Captain... what is this "urgent matter" we need to discuss?
I'm afraid you misinterpret our presence here. I want to reassure you that we have no hostile intentions.
Ah. Then I can report to my superiors that a fleet of twenty-three Federation starships is on our border for... humanitarian reasons? I doubt they are so gullible.
It is most certainly our intent to prevent any external power from interfering in Klingon affairs.
Nor do we have any plan to do so. But Captain... if for any reason we chose to enter Klingon territory... how would you stop us? With our cloaking devices we can slip by you at will.
Then why not send your ships across?
You sound eager for us to try... perhaps you've discovered a method of detecting our ships...
However... I don't think you asked me here to discuss our military situation.
All right. Why did I invite you?
You want the answer to the only real question on your mind... how could Tasha Yar be my mother?

It's been suggested that Tasha was aboard the Enterprise-C when it was destroyed twenty-four years ago. She was one of the survivors. You are obviously the product of a union between her and a Romulan.
But... you know that's impossible. She would have been a child when that battle occurred...
And yet you claim that it is possible -- that Tasha Yar was your mother.
Yes... she was on that ship twenty-four years ago. She was sent there... by you... from the future.

She was among those few who survived. They were all to have been executed after their interrogation. But a Romulan general saw her... and he became... enamored with her. So a bargain was struck: their lives would be spared if she became his consort. I was born a year later.
I want to meet her.
Who?
Your mother. Is she still alive?

One night... when I was four... she came to me, bundled me up and told me to stay quiet as we left the compound. I realized she was taking me away... away from my home, away from my father... so I cried out.
My father had offered her life. He had given her a home, given her a daughter. How did she repay him? With betrayal.
They executed her.
Everything in me that was human... died with my mother that day. All that is left... is Romulan. Never doubt that.
Doubts? I'm full of them. Nothing in my experience can assure me that what you say is true... but I do know one thing: it will not affect my judgment in our next encounter.
You have fourteen hours, Captain. I suggest you use them wisely.
Something wrong?
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Welcome, Worf... son of Mogh.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: What do you want?
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: The same as you... personal honor... and glory for the Empire.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Your family has never valued honor.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: You knew only our brother... we are not like him.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Our brother made many mistakes... one was to make you an enemy.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: We would rather be your friends.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Then you should not have opposed Gowron.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Gowron is nothing.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Toral is Duras' only son and he will be the next leader of the Council... in your heart, even you know that. But Captain Picard was right about one thing... Toral is not ready to rule the Empire.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: But we are... with your help.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: My help?
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Toral needs guidance...
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: ... a firm hand...
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: ... a father figure. That could be you. If you were mated to B'Etor.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: (heavy with sexual meaning) The rewards... could be greater than you can imagine.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: When the forces that follow you and your brother are united with ours... nothing will stand in our way.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: The Empire would be ours to rule together.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Join us, Worf... and we will usher in a new era for our people.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: An era where honor has no meaning... where Klingons trade loyalties in dark rooms... and where the Empire is ruled... from Romulus.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Enough, Lursa. You've failed. I need to know the strength and capabilities of the Federation fleet. I don't have time for this.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: Turn him over to the guard. B'Etor can have him back when they've finished with him.
scene: 48   INT. DURAS FAMILY HOME - CLOSE ON WORF

quote: In thirteen hours we will be forced to either withdraw from the border or fight the Romulan fleet. Neither of those alternatives is acceptable. We must expose their involvement before the deadline.
What is it you propose?
If you launch a massive attack now, the Duras forces will need supplies... Lursa and B'Etor will call for help... the Romulans will try to run the blockade... and we'll be ready for them.
And once the Romulan connection has been exposed... support will fall away from Lursa and B'Etor. Very well... I will make preparations.
One thing more, Picard. Worf has been captured by the Duras. I hope he dies well. Qapla!

When Gowron begins his attack, we'll make our move. The Excalibur will fall back with "engine problems." You will take the Hornet and the Akagi to this position... which will open a small gap in our detection net.
And if the Romulans already know about the tachyon field, they should try to run the blockade at that point.
Exactly. But when they try to send their ships through, the Enterprise and the Tian Nan Men will swing around, close the gap and catch them in the act.
Very nice. I'd better get back.
Good luck, Will.
Good luck, Captain.
We've just received an urgent message from Lursa and B'Etor. Gowron's forces have attacked in three sectors. The Duras are... nearing defeat...
You mean they were caught unprepared and now they're crying for help.
Have the science sections found a way to circumvent their detection grid yet?
We think so.
(continuing, indicating screen) Just before we cross the border, we'll send out a massive tachyon pulse. A burst that large should cause enough interference to disable a part of the network.
One of their ships is moving off the blockade line.
It's warp drive is failing.
Picard is redeploying the fleet to compensate for the missing ship... There's a gap opening in the net!
He doesn't have enough ships to maintain the network...
If we act quickly we can move through. (beat, as she does not respond) Commander?
No. I don't think so.
But it's what we've been waiting for.
Yes... I know... and so does Picard. He's giving us exactly what we need and he expects us to take it.
No... we won't step into Picard's trap. We will disable part of his network...
Here, where they're weakest... We'll direct the energy burst right at the ship with the android Captain.
Sir, the detection net is picking up activity from the Romulans... fifteen cloaked ships... spreading out along the border.
Signal the fleet to stand by.
Now.
Come to course zero eight zero mark two nine five!
There's a disruption in the tachyon detectors!
It's localized to this segment of the net...
Open a channel to the Sutherland.
Data here, sir.
We're reading a disruption of the tachyon net in your area.
Yes, sir. The Romulans have released a high-energy burst. The net is no longer effective in a radius of ten million kilometers around the Sutherland.
Sir... I've lost track of three ships already... and the rest of the convoy is moving toward the disruption.
That's where they're going through. Send a signal to the fleet... all ships to fall back and rendezvous at Gamma Eridon. We'll try to reestablish the net before they get there.
Aye, sir.
... all Federation ships proceed at maximum warp to Gamma Eridon.
Acknowledge the signal. Lay in the course and engage at warp nine point three.
Aye, sir.
What are you doing?
In disrupting the detection net, the Romulans may have caused a residual tachyon signature to form around their own ships.
But we have no way of detecting it.
All stop.
Aye, sir. All stop.
What? The fleet's been ordered to Gamma Eridon.
The tachyon signatures will not last long. By the time the fleet is redeployed, it will be too late. Begin to reconfigure sensors to detect ionized particle traces.
This entire area's been flooded with tachyon particles. We'll never be able to find what you're looking for.
I am aware of the difficulties. Please bring the phasers back on-line.
That will flood three decks with radiation!
We will initiate radiation protocol when necessary.
You don't give a damn about the people whose lives you're about to throw away. We're not just machines that you can---
Mister Hobson! You will carry out my orders or I will relieve you of duty.
Yes, sir.
Sir... the Sutherland isn't heading for the rendezvous point. She's come to a full stop.
Hail the Sutherland.
The Enterprise wants to know the reason we've stopped.
Display sensor schematic.
Begin sensor sweep, maximum range.
Are you going to answer the Enterprise?
Computer, overlay display with tachyon emissions.
Highlight any tachyon signatures which show subspace inertial displacement.
Concentrate a sensor sweep in that area.
Sir. This is pointless. Those readings could be anything. There's no way for us to prove the Romulans are out there.
Reconfigure the photon torpedo warhead yields. Set for a high- energy burst at level six.
At level six? But that won't even---
Do it.
Torpedoes ready. (sees something else on console) Another message coming in... it's Captain Picard!
Mister Data, you were ordered to rendezvous with the fleet at Gamma Eridon. Acknowledge.
Stand by, Captain. Mister Hobson, prepare to fire.
Didn't you hear that? Picard wants us---
Fire.
They have discovered us!
Reverse course. Order the fleet back to Romulan territory.
Commander! The Duras need this convoy. Without these supplies, they cannot win!
We've been exposed. It's over.
But what should I tell Lursa and B'Etor?
Tell them... they're on their own.
They're changing course... heading back to Romulan space.
The reconfigured particles from the photon torpedoes illuminated the tachyon signatures surrounding the Romulan ships...
Make a full report to the flagship. Take the main phasers off-line and begin radiation clean-up on the affected decks.
Yes, sir... ...Captain.
Defeat.
How? Where are the Romulans?
They never came.
Kill him.
No!!
Toral... next Leader of the Empire. Gowron is looking forward to seeing you again.
Captain's personal log, supplemental. It is with a profound sense of relief that I have ordered the fleet back to Federation territory following the news of Gowron's victory.
We have arrived at the Klingon Home World, where I will present the High Council with a full report on our encounter with the Romulans.
I am also... anxious to learn of Worf's fate.
Come.

Sir, I wish to submit myself for disciplinary action I disobeyed a direct order from a superior officer. Although there was a positive outcome as a result of my actions, I have learned that... the ends cannot justify the means.

No, they can't. However... the excuse "I was only following orders" is the epitaph of too many tragedies in our history. Starfleet does not want officers who will blindly follow orders without analyzing the situation. Your actions were appropriate for the circumstance, and I have noted that in your record.
Mister Data...
Nicely done.
Thank you, sir.
The Council appreciates your report, Captain. The information on the Romulan supply ships will prove very useful. Before you leave, there is one last matter to attend to.
Bring him!
Toral, son of Duras... you stand convicted of treason.
The Duras family will one day rule the Empire!
Perhaps... but not today. Worf...
This child's family wrongly took your name and your honor from you... In return, I give his life... to you.
What's wrong? Kill him!
No.
This is our way... the Klingon way.
I know... but it is not my way. This boy has done me no harm... and I will not kill him for the crimes of his family.
Then it falls to Kurn.
No. You gave his life to me... and I have spared it.
As you wish.
Permission to return to duty, sir?
Granted.
Captain's log, stardate 45571.2. We are going into orbit around an unexplored M-class moon of Mab-Bu Six. Though the moon was reported to be uninhabited, we have picked up a weak distress call.
The intense electromagnetic whirlwinds on the moon's surface make it virtually impossible to locate the source of the signal, sir...
Any indications of life, Mister Worf?
Scanners read negative, sir. But they may be affected by the interference.
Have you ever heard anything like that, Data?
I believe so, Commander... at Starfleet Academy...
The Academy?
Yes, sir, let me verify it...
As I thought, sir... it is a Starfleet subspace distress signal... standard to Daedalus class starships...
There hasn't been a Daedalus class in service for... what... ?
One hundred seventy-two years, Commander...
Any record of missing ships in this vicinity, Data?
The U.S.S. Essex under the command of Captain Bryce Shumar disappeared in this sector over two centuries ago...
Daedalus class...
Yes, Captain... I have accessed the subspace transponder signature of the Essex... it is identical to the signal coming from the moon's surface...
We've arrived a little late...
Mute it, Data.
With the storm activity down there, I don't think it's worth the risk to check on a ghost ship, Number One... advise Starfleet we've solved the mystery of Captain Shumar and the Essex...
I'm not sure we have...
Someone's down there... alive...
First officer's log, supplemental. The electromagnetic interference on the surface was judged too dangerous for anyone to transport down. So we have taken a shuttle to investigate.
Shields are holding...
Wind shear is incredible, Data... keep an eye on the stabilizers... If it's anything like this on the ground, I don't see how anyone could survive on this moon for long.
Maybe they've been living underground.
Question is where? I still can't locate the source of the damn signal... it's bouncing around more than we are...
Sir, forward thrusters have failed. We are losing power.
Enterprise... ?
Go ahead.
We've lost our thrusters... attempting to compensate with secondary boosters...
Sir? The shuttle's impulse generators have shut down...
Commander? Can you hear me?
Enterprise to shuttle, please respond.
Hold on! We're going down...
Initiating emergency landing procedures...
Maintain the approach attitude Data... I'm taking her in...
The shuttle has crashed on the surface...
Do you have their position?
I am picking up the shuttle's trace signature... but the surface interference is distorting its position...
Can you locate them...
I think I can... I followed their entry almost all the way in... we can calculate the coordinates from their angle of descent...
Enterprise?
It is unlikely, sir, that we will be able to establish communication with the ship, given the severe electromagnetic interference...
Then we'll stay put right here until the Enterprise finds us... Data, run an inventory of what's still usable inside the shuttle.
Yes sir.
Your arm...
Yeah, I'm pretty sure it's broken...
The surface is composed of nonporous rock... makes me think it's even more unlikely anyone could live here...
There are no instruments left of practical value that have not been damaged by the impact of our landing.
What is that?
Doesn't look like any storm front I've ever seen...
(checking with the tricorder) The tricorder is picking up high levels of E-M bursts across the spectrum.
Are you picking up anything else, Data... like signs of life... ?
Other than our own, sir... negative.
There is someone alive here... I'm more certain of it now than ever...
Well, I hope they can find us... because we don't have a way to find them...
They're coming... they're coming with the storm...
We can't get a pattern lock on the communicators because of the E-M bursts, Captain. There's no way to beam them out of there... not under these conditions...
The same conditions won't permit a shuttle to land safely, Mister LaForge... any suggestions... ?
Sir, let me beam down with a pattern enhancer...
Chief, there's no guarantee you won't rematerialize in a million pieces if your signal gets caught up in that electromagnetic whirlwind...
I can boost the confinement beam. One person might be able to make it...
Captain, Chief O'Brien wants to beam down to the surface with a pattern enhancer...
His chances of getting down there safely are no better than fifty- fifty in my judgement...
Captain, a major storm front is moving in on the away team's coordinates...
Mister O'Brien... you are aware of the risks?
Yessir. I think I can make it.
Prepare to transport.
Aye, sir.
Glad you could join us.
Great spot for a picnic, sir.
We need to distribute the enhancer rods at seven meter legs... that ought to do it...
Storm front going to affect the transport, Chief... ?
I'd really like to get us out of here before it hits, Commander... see, I'm supposed to be feeding the baby lunch... Molly gets in a terribly foul mood if I'm late...
I'm with you...
Lunch time, O'Brien! Let's do it!
Easy, Deanna...
W-where... ?
You're back on the Enterprise... Everything's okay now.
But my skin... It's tingling.
You are experiencing some afterimages from the electromagnetic discharge. The sensation will pass. Try to relax...
They're all fine, too. Now take your time, Counselor, okay? Doctor's orders.
Injury report, Doctor?

Mostly minor abrasions. But Commander Riker took the worst of it with a broken arm... The biofilter scans showed their nervous systems were generating unusally high levels of synaptic energy. I don't think it's anything to worry about...
Good work, Mister O'Brien.
Thank you, sir.
Ready for duty, Captain.
Are you sure, Number One?
(nods, flexes his injured arm) It's not the first bone I've broken.
And how are you, Counselor?
Very glad to be here.
What happened down there?
It was just one hell of a storm... moved in on our position faster than anything I've ever seen.
Did you find any evidence of life?
No, but if Troi was right, we weren't far away from it...
Bridge. How do you suggest we proceed?
We're gonna have to find a way to modify the scanners to penetrate those storms. Got any ideas, Data... ?
It is p-p-possible we might be able to employ virtual imaging to interpolate missing data...
Is there something wrong, Data?
My apologies. It seems my primary speech processors are experiencing a minor fluctuation. I will have it corrected in a... m-m-moment.
Captain... may I speak with you a moment? In private?
Of course, Counselor. Take the bridge, Number One.
Mister Data, deploy sensor scans when you're ready. Ensign, move into a synchronous orbit aligned with our crash site.
Aye sir.
Sir? Given the E-M field properties of this moon, I would recommend a search pattern beginning at the southern p-p-polar region.
The polar region... But that's starting from scratch, Data. The last reading we had on the Essex would suggest we begin the scans near our crash site...
The Essex signal was never clearly located, sir.
A broader, systematic survey of the moon from a p-p-polar orbit might be more practical.
Well, you might be right. Still, I'd like to give the crash site a once-over first... We'll maintain our present orbit for now.
Understood, sir.
I've never felt anything quite like it... It was almost as though they were calling to me...
Are you saying someone was communicating telepathically, Counselor?
Perhaps. For an instant. It was like their voices were carried on the wind.
What were they trying to communicate?
I'm not sure... but they were calling me to the southern polar region... I believe that's where we should look for the Essex...
Commander? Did you override my orbital heading?
Override them?
We've moved into a polar orbit.
I'm locked out, the helm isn't responding...
Mister Data, do you know anything about this?
Data... ?
Security to the bridge!
Computer, transfer command to engineering... Full security alert!
All command functions transferred to engineering.
This way!
What happened?
He would not move to a polar orbit.
You could not wait? The captain would have done it for me...
Deck thirty-six. Engineering.
Computer, reenable bridge control. Authorization: Riker-Omega-Three...
Report...
They're in turbolift four.
Engaging turbolift override controls, now...
They have t-t-trapped us... what will we do?
What deck is this?
We are on deck ten.
Can you move us again?
I know how to override the bridge command...
Activate all security fields on decks eight through fifteen...
Sir? The turbolift is moving again. They're still inside.
Initiate emergency bulkheads in turboshaft four...
Aye, sir. They've been stopped at deck thirteen.
Mister Worf...
Do you know how to deactivate this?
The computer will not allow us to override an emergency forcefield command...
My entity's artificial substructure may be useful...
They've broken through a security field, deck ten, section two...
Security to Ten Forward...
Shh... Mama's right here...
Everyone get down on the floor!
Miles... ?
On the floor!
Everyone down! Now!!
Multiple phaser shots in Ten Forward.
Picard to Worf -- report.
Mister Worf... acknowledge.
Can you hear me, Lieutenant Worf?
Yes, bridge. He can hear you.
Position security teams at both entrances...
Yes sir.
Mister La Forge, shut down all computer access in Ten Forward...
I can't, Captain. They've already set up a remote security lock-out... We'd have to shut down all computer functions in the saucer section...
Transporter room three, can you get a pattern lock on Commander Data, Counselor Troi and Chief O'Brien in Ten Forward... ?
Attempting to lock on, sir...
You were correct. They are attempting to engage their transporters. But I know how to shut them down.
Bridge, the entire transporter array has been taken off-line and placed in a diagnostic mode... I can't override... it will take a couple of hours to complete the cycle...
How many people are down there?
Seventeen... They just shut down the internal scanners too, Captain.
Doctor Crusher to the bridge...
On my way.
What are you doing now?
I can reverse the p-polarity of their forcefields to isolate this room.
Good.
Their communicators. Now they will learn nothing but what we tell them.
They've done something to the force fields on deck ten, section one.
Geordi?
I don't recognize the configurations... But they've completely isolated Ten Forward.
How about flooding their air vents with anesthizine gas?
That won't affect Data. No rescue plan will work if we don't knock out all three of them.
A concussive charge would blow out the security field. Then we could go in with phasers on wide beam. Stun everybody. Sort it out later...
Doctor, go back to the biofilter readouts taken during the away team's transport from the moon's surface... see if you can come up with any kind of clue that might explain this...
Ten Forward, this is Captain Picard. I am prepared to discuss this situation. There is no need for further violence...
Please identify yourself.
They will now attempt to negotiate for the safety and release of their people. Interesting. Under normal circumstances, I would be counseling the captain at a time like this...
What would you tell him to do?
I would help him find a way to secure our trust.
W-what are you looking at?
I am speaking to you, Klingon.
Attack me. Or are you afraid?
I have no fear of death.
And I have no fear of killing you...
Stop it.
Please respond, Ten Forward. Are there any members of my crew who require medical assistance?
We can discuss your wounded, Captain. But first, you will move the ship.
Move it where?
You will will change the ship's orbit to an inclination of eighty degrees, south.
The southern polar region -- that's where Data tried to move the ship.
And exactly what Troi asked me to do, but why? Ten Forward -- if you could be more specific about our intended destination, perhaps we could...
You have thirty seconds to change your heading -- or additional members of your crew will "require medical attention."
We need to stabilize this situation and play for time. I suggest we move the ship as they have asked. Agreed?
Set the new heading. But take us there as slowly as you can... (nods to Ro to resume com) Ten Forward, we are moving the ship as you requested.
He's telling the truth... their heading has changed...

I've compared the away team's last transport trace patterns to earlier records. They're exactly the same, except in Troi, Data and O'Brien there's an unusual synaptic activity -- some kind of anionic energy. It may be a life-form superimposing neural patterns onto our people.
Why wasn't I affected?
I don't know. But one difference between you and the others was that you were injured.
My broken arm...
The fracture caused pain receptors to fire which may have made you immune... to this energy.
If your theory is accurate, what would happen if we inflicted pain on the others...
That might force whatever it is out of our people.
A plasma shock -- it would be painful but it wouldn't cause any physical harm.
I could hook up a modified laser scanner to a plasma invertor...
What about Data?
A plasma shock would certainly overload his neural net. It might work for him too...
We'd have to find a way to penetrate the forcefield around Ten Forward.
I might be able to interrupt the forcefield for a few seconds... but I'll be fighting the computer for control... timing would be critical...
We'd have to hit all three with a single discharge... if they're standing together, it shouldn't be a problem...
How would you gain access?
We could use a micro-optic drill through the ceiling and they'd never detect it...
If this is going to work, we need some way to contain that anionic energy after we get it out of our people.
Yes, Doctor... that will be your top priority. Very well. Proceed.
Bridge to Ten Forward. Now that we are moving the ship as you requested, I would like to know the nature of the injuries to members of my crew.
Five of your people have been injured.
How serious is their condition?
You tell him, Klingon.
Captain. One person has suffered what looks like a level five phaser hit...
And four others have secondary burns. They require medical attention...
And our captors are not affected by phaser stun settings...
Silence, Klingon.
Ten Forward -- those people must be released so they can receive proper medical treatment.
I will release no one.
If you release the wounded... I will take their place.
It may be a... d-deception.
The crew values Picard's life above all others... Captain Picard. We agree to your proposal.
Expect a medical team to accompany me.
Acknowledged.
Picard to sickbay. Send an emergency medical team to meet me outside Ten Forward.
Sir, putting you down there just strengthens their position.
As long as they're on board, I'm a hostage no matter where I am. We all are. I must find out who we are dealing with...
If La Forge and Ro can attempt a rescue in short order, proceed with it. If they can't... I'll provide you with another opportunity. Watch for it.
Yes, sir...
Silence that... ch-child!
I know you. I know who you are...
And I know who this is...
She's frightened... why don't you let us go?
No. Make it stop.
Ten Forward, we are outside the door.
Lower the force field.
Welcome, Captain. Allow me to introduce myself...
I am Captain Bryce Shumar, of the Federation Starship Essex.
The Starship Essex vanished over two hundred years ago...
Indeed. I know. I was there.
This is my First Officer... Commander Steven Mullen. And my Security Chief... Lieutenant Morgan Kelly.
You're telling me that you've survived this long as... (searching for the right word)
Spirits? Ghosts? But you are a man who would never believe in ghosts, Picard. Isn't that true?
You see, I know you. Troi knows you. And so I do, as well.
Then Counselor Troi is still... alive?
Yes, of course she is, and I have no wish to harm her. Or to harm anyone else.
I'm pleased to hear that.
We have been forced to take this action because we need your help, Captain.
My help... ?
Our consciousness has been trapped on this moon for two centuries... we must escape this torture...
How did this happen to you?

I cannot explain how it occurred, only that it did. The Essex was caught in an electromagnetic storm just as your shuttle was. Moments before we crashed, the bridge was struck by lightning. The ship was ripped apart. Somehow, in that instant, our consciousness was absorbed in the magnetic currents on the surface.
Why didn't you tell us this? Why the deception, the violence?
As I said, Captain. I knew you wouldn't believe us. Even now, I'm sure you do not.
What was your vessel designation and complement?
NCC One-seven-three... Daedalus class starship. Crew of two hundred twenty-nine.
Under whose command in this sector?
Admiral Uttan Narsu, Starbase Twelve. You will find all of this in Starfleet records...
I do not need to see the records.
Then you know I am correct.
End this now and I will do whatever I can to help you...
No. You do not trust me. And I cannot risk trusting you.
It is taking too long. We sh-should have been there by now...
He is manipulating you...
Captain Picard has every right to be curious...
He will try to delay until a rescue attempt is possible.
I know that. But I also know that he will make every effort to protect the lives of his crew.
Since our demands are not excessive, I hope you will see it is simpler to accede than to risk further injuries.
What do you want?
All you need to know for now, Captain, is that we want to rest. Simply, finally... to rest.
... Section Two - B... A... Section One...
Finally. I hope I never see this part of the Enterprise again...
I hear you. This is what starship designers call "easy access"...
This is it. I thought we might have a problem with conduit two- twenty-seven -- but it looks like we can get by it...
We're through...
Let's hook up the scanner and see what we've got...
Got it...
All three of them have to be in the circle if it's going to work...
We're halfway home... La Forge to Crusher. How's it going?

I think I've come up with an idea for a containment field. This anionic energy seems to be vulnerable to the same magnetic flux density we monitored in the storms. If I can duplicate that, we can trap it once it's out of our people.
You ought to be able to do it by pumping Ten Forward full of ionogenic particles.
Exactly what I was thinking...
How long will it take to get it all ready?
We still have to calibrate the plasma invertor, Commander... I'm guessing forty-five minutes to an hour...
I'll have the containment field ready by then.
Keep me advised.
Impressions, Mister Worf?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Spiritual possessions of this sort have been reported throughout Klingon history. It is called "Jat'yIn" -- the taking of the living by the dead.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Yes, Human history is also full of similar legends.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Then, you believe they may be telling the truth?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Not for a moment.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Sir, they seem to know much about the Essex... if it really is the spirit of Captain Shumar...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: ... then he should be on much better behavior, don't you think... ? A Starfleet Captain?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: After living disembodied for two centuries, perhaps they have gone mad...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Mister Worf, I assure you these are not Jat'yIn. Our job is to find out what they are... and then to determine how to deal with them...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Stop speaking!
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: I gave you that...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: In a place called McKinley Park. Green grass... tall trees.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Please... don't...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: I hid the bracelet... in your pocket. You were... surprised.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: ...please...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: You said, "You make me so happy, Miles."
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Get away from me.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Get away.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Leave her alone.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Captain Shumar...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: We will reach the polar position you requested in minutes... I will need to give additional instructions...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: (takes a beat to consider) Very well. We are taking you to our crash site...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: At the southern pole... ?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: That is correct.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Nothing our sensors were able to detect indicated that the Essex went down in the polar region...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Well, it d-did.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: I told you, Captain... the ship broke apart in the atmosphere. The bridge went down here.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: When we reach it, you are going to beam what's left of our skeletal remains aboard this ship... and take them back to Earth for a proper burial.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: See how simple a request it is... ?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Let these people go... and I will order the bridge to follow your instructions.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: No. No one will be released.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: If you are who you say you are, there is no need for any of this... we will gladly take you home.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: I wish you were truly so open-minded, Picard...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: If you do not release the hostages, I will not cooperate.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: You will cooperate... you will c-cooperate... or someone will die, Captain... who will it be... ?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: How about the Klingon?
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Get another one.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: You.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: No... please...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Pick one to die, Captain. Or I will kill them both...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: Choose me, Captain.
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: They're all in range. I need to do it now...
scene: 75   INT. TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF
location: TEN FORWARD ON PICARD AND WORF

quote: I'm only gonna be able to shut down the forcefield for about seven seconds before the computer compensates...
If they're the right seven seconds, it'll be enough...
Bridge, stand by to release the ionogenic field on my signal...
Standing by...
Ready...
Kill the forcefield!
Forcefield down...
Firing plasma charge...
Damn... !
Tell them to stop, or I'll kill everyone in this room! Starting with you.
Picard to bridge. Abort immediately.
As you say, Captain... Riker to La Forge, return to the bridge.
Are you prepared to cooperate?
Yes.
First officer's log, supplemental. The Enterprise has moved into a synchronous orbit near the southern polar region. We await further instructions from Ten Forward.
Any sign of the Essex?
Negative, Commander. The electromagnetic disturbances are even worse here... scanners can't read a thing...
Bridge to Ten Forward.
Intense storm activity over the southern pole is making it virtually impossible for us to pick up any trace of the Essex...
We're giving you the exact coordinates of our remains aboard the wreck of the Essex...
I'm receiving the coordinates now...
Geordi, can you tell what's there?
Just your basic ionic cyclone. I can't read a thing.
I'm sure as hell not going to just beam up whatever might be down there...
I've got a good excuse for you. The transporters aren't going to work any better than the scanners...
Bridge to Ten Forward... the same interference that is blocking our scanners would prevent us from using the transporters...
They're lying...
On the contrary, we've had a difficult time with transport since our arrival... that's why we had to send down the shuttle. You should all be well aware of that fact.
We must be able to use the transporters...
In fact, Chief O'Brien was the one who successfully executed the return of the away team... he is the most qualified on board to operate the transporter under these circumstances...
Can you do it from here?
No... I would have to use a transporter pad.
I would be willing to grant you safe passage to the transporter pad in one of the cargo bays...
It is a trick... he is trying to divide us...
We must not be separated.
I offer to grant you all safe passage.
Why are you b-being so helpful suddenly?
Because I assume if you go to the cargo bay, you will choose not to take all of the hostages. Their safety is my primary concern.
What are the risks when we leave this room?
Without the p-protection of the forcefield, we are vulnerable in a number of ways...

They could use the transporter against us... Once the forcefield's down, they could beam us back to the surface. (beat, as he gets an idea) But there is a way to neutralize that threat... Bridge, transfer all transporter functions to Ten Forward...
Ten Forward, in order to do that, you'll have to release your computer control lock-outs...
That is not true...
Let me speak to him.
Number One, I think we have an opportunity to end this seige...

But it will require cooperation from all concerned. Our guests will be moving shortly to cargo bay four, where the transport will occur. You are to ensure their safe passage from Ten Forward to the cargo bay.
Understood, Captain. Mister La Forge, Doctor...
Aye, sir...
Transporter controls are being transferred...
Ten Forward to bridge. I said all transporter controls. Including those aboard all your shuttlecraft.
Almost had them, Ensign... nice try... Ten Forward. Our mistake. Remaining transporter functions are being transferred to you...
By creating our own access code, we will be able to prevent anyone from using the transporter against us as we move to the cargo bay...
What about their weapons?
We will each take a hostage for protection... Captain Picard, you are mine.
Please... let her stay...
Lower the forcefield.
Security teams, stand by.
They're heading through section five...
Mister La Forge, Doctor -- they'll be at their destination in less than a minute...
They've stopped at deck eighteen, sir...
Security, allow them access into cargo bay four...
I will require some assistance.
Captain Shumar, may I ask a foolish question?
You are not one to ask foolish questions, Picard...
Nevertheless, I must ask how you intend to achieve your "rest"... when all is said and done...
What do you mean?
How do you intend to free yourself of this existence that has trapped your consciousness?
It will fade as we move further from this planet...
Really? What is your scientific basis for that?
I don't need a scientific basis. Just be quiet.
Perhaps you will be required to perform a noble deed before you can rest.
What are you talking about?
Surely you recall the old story of "The Canterville Ghost"...
Do not insult me with foolish ghost stories, Picard...
I would ask the same of you. When are you going to tell me who you really are?
I have initialized the transporter signal...
(still staring at Picard) Proceed.
They're powering up the transporter, Commander...
Mister LaForge...
I've isolated cargo bay four with a neutrino field, sir... But it won't take O'Brien and Data more than a couple of minutes to override it once they discover it's there...
I hope that'll be enough time for the captain to play his hand...
You know what he's going to do?
There's only one reason he chose cargo bay four... If it becomes necessary, Ensign, you will blow the cargo bay hatch on my orders.
Aye, sir.
You're quite right, Picard. We're not ghosts. And it is not rest, we seek. Only escape.
Escape?

We were brought to this moon over five centuries ago from a star system called Ux-Mal... We were separated from our bodies and left to drift in the storms. Once we almost escaped... on board the Essex... but that ship was incapable of eluding the moon's electromagnetic currents...
Did you really think using their identities would gain our sympathy... ?
It was a better approach than asking you to allow hundreds of condemned prisoners on board...
Then, this moon is a penal colony...
That is correct. But now we have your ship... and your bodies to carry us home...
I'm reading dozens of them... hundreds...
They have the same anionic signature we saw on the biofilter scans...
I think we can give the captain a new bargaining chip. Doctor Crusher, flood the cargo bay with your containment field...
Let them go, or you will all die.
Your threats are meaningless now.
We are still in control of these three bodies. We will not leave them.
Are you prepared to sacrifice the lives of the others? Because they will all die when the hatch to the cargo bay is blown...
You will die too...
I would die to save the life of my child.
To die defending his ship is the hope of every Klingon.
And if you each know the officers you inhabit, you know they are equally ready to give their lives for this ship. Free them now... And I will return you to the moon's surface.
I advise you, Picard, not to pass our way again.
Picard to bridge, our guests will be leaving shortly... I need an emergency medical team here...
On our way, Captain.
Mister Worf, transport these... prisoners... back to the moon's surface...
Gladly, sir...
It was almost as though my own consciousness were pushed to the side... I was watching it all happen... hearing my own voice... but I couldn't control any of it...
What about the entity that controlled you... what were your perceptions of him?
He was intelligent, actually. Thoughtful... in a ruthless sort of way. Cold.
I must apologize for my inadvertant misconduct toward you, Lieutenant.
There is no need to apologize.
Your restraint was most remarkable for a Klingon.
You have no idea.
How do you feel?
Hungry.
Good sign.
How do you feel?
I'm just glad to have you back.
If I could've killed that thing inside me... I would have...
I know.
We both know.

Captain's Log, Stardate 46071.6. We have been called to the aid of a transport ship, which has been attacked near Rekag-Seronia. Hostilities between the two factions on that planet have intensified recently, threatening an important Federation shipping route.
Captain, sensors have located the transport ship. Two Rekag battle cruisers are flanking it.
Red alert. Shields up.
Phasers on line. Photon torpedoes armed and ready.
Is the transport still under attack?
The cruisers' weapons are powered up... but...
Sir, the Rekag ships are turning and heading out of sensor range.
They don't want to take on the Enterprise...
We are within visual range of the transport, Sir.
On screen.
Sensors indicate damage to the Dorian's sub space emitters. Audio communication only.
Open a channel, Mister Worf.
Aye, sir.
This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the Federation starship Enterprise.
Captain Talmadge of the Dorian. Glad you're here... we took some shield damage from the Rekag ships... but we couldn't have held out if they attacked again.
Do you have injuries? Can we assist you in any way?
No injuries... but I'd like permission to transport a couple of guests to your ship.
Of course...
We're conveying a mediator to Seronia. I think he's the reason the Rekags fired on us...
...travelling... negotiations...
Captain, I'm losing you. Go ahead and beam your passengers on board...
Counselor, will you see to our guests' needs and then escort them to my Ready Room.
Yes, Captain.
I'm Counselor Deanna Troi.
Ambassador Ves Alkar... ... and my mother, Sev Maylor. Counselor, it's imperative that I speak with your Captain...
You think he's attracted to you... but he isn't. You offer him nothing...
She hasn't been well. Could she be taken to quarters?
Of course. Chief... I'll take you to meet Captain Picard...
Go with him...
Don't pursue him. I won't have it... I'll stop you...

I am grateful for the Federation's offer to escort me, but if I arrive at Rekag-Seronia on the Enterprise, the armed Flagship of Starfleet, my mission as a Peace negotiator will be compromised. There must be a Federation transport ship in the area that could take me there.
With all due respect, Admiral -- to put the Ambassador on another unarmed transport will only invite a second assault.
I believe the attack on us was an isolated incident, nothing more...
Ambassador Alkar... the Rekag-Seronia dispute has threatened Federation ships for many months. We are grateful that you are willing to undertake this mission... and you have our full support.
Thank you, sir.

However, we also recognize that safety is an issue -- not just yours, but the crew that escorts you. To send you on an unarmed transport puts everyone at risk. I think it's best if you proceed to Rekag-Seronia aboard the Enterprise.
Then I have no choice.
Once you get to Rekag-Seronia, you may conduct your negotiations as you see fit. Until then -- you'll be in good hands with Captain Picard.
... I understand.
Good luck, and a successful journey.
Picard to Riker.
Yes, sir?
Set a course for Seronia.
That is all for today. There will be another class tomorrow at oh-seven-hundred hours.
The skills are demanding... You're very disciplined.
I believe in a strong connection between body and mind. You obviously share that conviction.
Yes... Only sometimes I have a problem getting my body to conform to my mind's wishes...
